Beyond academic coursework, the program provides comprehensive support including PSAT and SAT preparation, college and academic counseling, and career development workshops. Students admitted to S-PREP are also eligible to apply for specialized summer research internships in neuroscience and cancer research through affiliated programs like BRAINYAC and YES in THE HEIGHTS.

results.name: High School Space Exploration Camp
results.title: Summer Camps
results.subtitle: Clemson University
results.description: The Clemson University Science Outreach Center provides engaging educational experiences for students through its dedicated Summer Camps. These programs are divided into residential and day camp options, allowing for different levels of immersion in scientific study. In addition to these seasonal camps, the center facilitates lab field trips and specialized programs for homeschool students to expand their knowledge of the sciences. The curriculum is supported by the College of Science and aims to promote outreach and interest in various STEM fields through hands-on learning. Prospective participants can expect to explore various scientific topics while interacting with university-level resources and expertise.

results.name: Pre-College Summer Academies
results.title: Pre-College Summer Academies
results.subtitle: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
results.description: The Rutgers Pre-College Summer Academies provide high school students completing their sophomore or junior year with a one-week immersive residential experience to explore academic and career interests. Participants reside in campus dormitories while attending daily academic workshops, lectures, and tours led by leading practitioners and university instructors. Students choose from specialized tracks such as Engineering, Pre-Law, or Marketing to practice essential skills and competencies required for success in their chosen fields. Beyond the classroom, the program includes scheduled evening activities and social events managed by program assistants to foster connections among the student cohort. Participants who complete the program earn a Rutgers Pre-College Digital Badge to enhance their college applications and professional resumes.

results.name: Residency Program
results.title: NYSSSA In-Residency Program
results.subtitle: New York State Education Department
results.description: The NYSSSA In-Residency Program is an initiative designed to provide intensive training for students in various artistic disciplines. Since its inception in 1970, the program has successfully trained over 20,000 students through the New York State Summer School of the Arts. It operates under the Office of Cultural Education to offer professional-level instruction and provides opportunities through the Empire State Summer Arts Scholarship Program. Students can explore diverse resources including image and video galleries that showcase the work produced during the program. Prospective applicants and interested residential life staff can access information regarding the application process and employment opportunities through the official department channels.

results.name: Explore Cyber Threats and Security
results.title: Cybersecurity: Protecting Our Digital Future
results.subtitle: Georgetown University
results.description: Georgetown University offers a comprehensive cybersecurity program designed for students ages 13 and up to explore the evolving landscape of digital threats and defense strategies. Participants delve into the history of cyberspace, the mechanics of hacking, and the impact of artificial intelligence on security while learning from industry experts from organizations like the FBI and CISA. The curriculum offers two distinct pathways: an enrichment track providing 20 to 30 hours of instruction and a college credit track featuring 128 hours of coursework and a university transcript. Both modalities include dedicated mentoring, flexible online video lessons, and a final capstone project where students simulate ransomware responses or create educational infographics.

results.name: Digital Marketing Academy
results.title: High School Summer Discovery
results.subtitle: UCLA Anderson School of Management
results.description: High School Summer Discovery at UCLA Anderson offers students in grades 9-12 the opportunity to explore future careers through intensive academies focused on sports business, entertainment, digital marketing, and the music industry. Participants choose from two, three, or five-week sessions where they learn fundamental business frameworks including finance, marketing, strategy, and economics. Taught by industry experts and university instructors, the curriculum features hands-on experiences such as case studies, team projects, and site visits to major studios and stadiums. Beyond the classroom, the program provides a front-row seat to college life through residential or commuter options, social excursions, and access to campus athletic facilities. Students gain independence and 21st-century skills like teamwork and communication while receiving a certificate of completion upon finishing the program.

results.name: NYC Commuter Summer

program_dates.label: Multiple Sessions (Session AA, A, B - 7 Weeks)

results.title: NYC Commuter Summer
results.subtitle: Columbia University Pre-College Programs
results.description: This academic program provides students entering grades 9–12 and incoming college freshmen the opportunity to engage in high-level coursework led by expert instructors. Participants choose from more than 70 courses spanning a dozen subject areas, attending intensive classes designed to foster critical and independent thinking. Students commuting to campus gain access to university resources such as libraries, specialized lounges, and early evening co-curricular programming. After finishing the program, attendees earn a Certification of Participation and a formal evaluation letter to support their future college application processes.

results.name: MITES Program
results.title: MITES Summer
results.subtitle: Massachusetts Institute of Technology
results.description: MITES Summer is a six-week on-campus immersion program at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology designed for high school juniors who are U.S. citizens or permanent residents. Participants engage in five rigorous courses across mathematics, life sciences, physics, and humanities, alongside project-based electives like Machine Learning and Architecture. Beyond classroom instruction, students participate in lab tours, social events, and seminars with STEM professionals to gain firsthand insights into technical careers. The program provides comprehensive support including college admissions counseling, room and board at no cost, and written evaluations from instructors for use in future applications.

results.name: Introduction to Logic
results.title: Logic For All
results.description: Logic For All is a specialized program designed to introduce students to the foundational principles of formal logic and deductive reasoning. The curriculum focuses on developing critical thinking skills through the study of symbolic logic and its practical applications. Participants work through a series of exercises that explore logical connectives, truth tables, and formal proofs. This educational initiative aims to make high-level analytical concepts approachable for students interested in mathematics and computer science.

results.name: Music Pre-College
results.title: Music
results.subtitle: Carnegie Mellon University
results.description: Carnegie Mellon University’s Pre-College Music program is an immersive experience designed to mirror the first weeks of a freshman conservatory curriculum, preparing students for the demands of a music major. High school participants can enroll in majors such as instrumental or vocal performance, composition, and music technology, with curriculum options including both full-time residential and part-time commuter tracks. The program features a comprehensive course load involving private studio lessons, music theory, performing ensembles, and specialized seminars led by world-class faculty. To further prepare for future college applications, all full-time students participate in mandatory end-of-summer mock conservatory auditions and receive personalized written feedback on their performance and coursework.

results.name: Summer Youth Program
results.title: UCI Writing Project
results.subtitle: UC Irvine School of Education
results.description: The UCI Writing Project provides diverse educational opportunities for youth, ranging from grade 1 through high school, through both in-person and virtual formats. Students can engage in writing workshops exploring narrative, persuasive, and reflective genres, or participate in specialized sessions like podcasting and college application preparation. The curriculum also features STEM-oriented courses in mathematics, science, and computer science, including Scratch coding and the integration of artificial intelligence in app creation. Registration for these programs involves a mandatory student code of conduct and a liability waiver, which includes a photography release. Financial options include single-course registration or discounted full-day packages for those participating in both morning and afternoon sessions.

results.name: Drama Pre-College
results.title: Drama
results.subtitle: Carnegie Mellon University
results.description: The Pre-College Drama program at Carnegie Mellon University offers high school juniors and seniors an intensive conservatory experience designed to mirror a professional Bachelor of Fine Arts curriculum. Students select from three distinct tracks—Acting, Music Theater, or Design/Production Technology and Management—to develop specialized skills and a professional repertoire. The curriculum covers a wide range of subjects including audition techniques, dramaturgy, acting for the camera, technical production, and stage management. Beyond core requirements, participants can customize their experience through electives like improvisation, dramatic writing, and directing. The program culminates in mock auditions and portfolio reviews, providing students with critical feedback to navigate the college admission and interview process.

results.name: Computational Biology Pre-College
results.title: Computational Biology
results.subtitle: Carnegie Mellon University
results.description: The Pre-College Program in Computational Biology at Carnegie Mellon University offers high school sophomores and juniors an interdisciplinary experience that blends laboratory experimentation with advanced computational analysis. Students engage in a daily schedule split between hands-on lab work, where they isolate and sequence DNA from environmental samples, and hackathon sessions focused on coding solutions for biological datasets. Participants gain experience with cutting-edge technology, including robotic laboratory equipment and artificial intelligence platforms, to understand how modern science addresses real-world problems like genome assembly and evolutionary tree construction. Admitted students are required to complete foundational coding modules prior to arrival and must bring their own laptop to support the program's heavy emphasis on programming and data interpretation. This four-week program provides both residential and commuter tracks for eligible students who maintain at least a 3.0 grade point average and demonstrate a strong interest in math and science.

results.name: Native Education Forum
results.title: Pre-College Program Application
results.subtitle: NC State University
results.description: The Pre-College Program Application provides prospective students with a central portal to engage with the academic environment at NC State University. Through this platform, students can explore a wide variety of majors, minors, and pre-professional programs designed to facilitate career development and academic growth. The initiative offers high-impact experiences and access to campus resources such as university libraries, student services, and global engagement opportunities. This program is intended for individuals seeking to enhance their educational background and prepare for the transition to undergraduate studies.

results.name: Arizona State University
results.title: The Science and Engineering Experience (SCENE)
results.subtitle: Arizona State University
results.description: The Science and Engineering Experience (SCENE) provides cutting-edge research opportunities to high school sophomores, juniors, and seniors who are considering careers in science or engineering. Participants work in state-of-the-art labs under the guidance of university professors and students to answer original research questions across disciplines such as biodesign, physics, and sustainable engineering. Students are expected to commit approximately six to twelve hours per week to their projects, which involve background study, experimental design, and hands-on laboratory work. The program culminates in students presenting their findings at regional and national science competitions to earn awards and recognition from professional scientists.

results.name: Annenberg Youth Academy
results.title: Annenberg Youth Academy for Media and Civic Engagement
results.subtitle: USC Annenberg School for Communication and Journalism
results.description: The Annenberg Youth Academy for Media and Civic Engagement is a three-week summer intensive academy designed for 26 talented high school students from the communities surrounding the USC University Park and Health Science Campuses. Participants are exposed to the equivalent of first-year college-level courses that emphasize the role of media communications and journalism in developing civic-minded thought leaders. The program strengthens essential competencies such as writing, critical thought, public speech, debate, multimedia production, interviewing, and ethnography. Students receive college advising and essay preparation from the admission team while meeting with innovative scholars and practitioners who are shaping the future of communication and public relations. Applicants must reside and attend high school within Los Angeles County to be eligible for the program, which includes provided meals and opportunities for transportation scholarships.

results.name: RSI Program
results.title: Research Science Institute
results.subtitle: Center for Excellence in Education
results.description: The Research Science Institute is a cost-free summer program for high-achieving high school juniors that combines theoretical coursework with hands-on science and technology research. Participants engage in the entire research cycle, which includes reading current literature, executing a detailed research plan, and delivering professional reports on their findings. The program structure includes intensive STEM classes led by accomplished professors followed by a multi-week internship where students conduct individual projects under the guidance of expert mentors. In the final stage of the experience, scholars prepare and present conference-style oral and written reports to demonstrate their scientific results. This program is designed specifically for students who demonstrate significant accomplishment in science and engineering fields and are entering their final year of secondary school.

results.name: Entrepreneurship Competition
results.title: Blue Ocean Student Entrepreneur Competition
results.subtitle: Blue Ocean Student Entrepreneurs Corporation
results.description: The Blue Ocean Student Entrepreneur Competition is a virtual entrepreneurship challenge open to high school students aged 14 to 18 from around the world. Participants may compete individually or in teams of up to five members to develop a business idea that solves a real-world problem using specific strategy tools and frameworks. Before submitting, all competitors must complete a mandatory mini-course to learn about blue ocean strategy and utilize required templates to structure their pitches. The entry process involves recording a video pitch under five minutes in length, uploading it to YouTube with a specific hashtag, and submitting the link for evaluation based on criteria like value innovation and market potential. Successful participants can earn cash prizes for top global and regional placements, while all students who submit a pitch are awarded a certificate of participation.

results.name: Summer Engineering
results.title: School of Engineering
results.subtitle: University of Dayton
results.description: The University of Dayton School of Engineering provides a range of academic pathways including eight undergraduate degree programs, four co-majors, and over 25 minors in fields such as chemical, civil, computer, electrical, and mechanical engineering. Prospective students unsure of their path can utilize the Discover Engineering and Discover Engineering Technology programs to explore academic options before finalizing a major while remaining on track for graduation. Students gain real-world experience through the Engineering Co-op and Internship Office, which connects them with leading industry partners for paid placements and senior design projects. Specialized opportunities include ETHOS Center immersions for community-engaged social impact projects, research collaborations like the Sensors Directorate Internship Program with Air Force Research Laboratories, and training at the Innovation Center. Holistic advisors support students in crafting personalized flight plans that incorporate global learning, student organizations, and advanced degree options including master’s and doctoral programs.

results.name: Immersive Summer
results.title: Immersive Summer Interacting with Technology and Engineering (I-SITE)
results.subtitle: NYU
results.description: Immersive Summer Interacting with Technology and Engineering (I-SITE) is an interdisciplinary program designed for high school students in grades 9, 10, or 11 who demonstrate academic strength and a strong interest in STEM fields. Participants engage in six weeks of rigorous coursework and labs covering physical computing, robotics, computer science, and machine learning using state-of-the-art tools such as PyTorch and Arduino. The curriculum includes specialized workshops on scientific ethics, public speaking, and presentation training to help develop well-rounded technical skills. Students culminate their experience with a week-long team challenge where they prototype and demonstrate solutions to contemporary societal problems, such as climate change or cybersecurity. Applicants should have completed Algebra 2 and possess some prior computer programming experience to be competitive for the program.

results.name: GIS Challenge

program_dates.label: Finalists Presentation at Countdown to Discovery

results.title: Genes in Space
results.subtitle: Genes in Space
results.description: Genes in Space invites U.S. students in grades 7 through 12 to design innovative biotechnology experiments for potential deployment in space. Participants may enter as individuals or in pairs and must be supported by an adult sponsor, such as a teacher or mentor. The application process requires students to identify a space biology topic with a molecular or genetic basis and define a specific research hypothesis using the program's specialized toolkit. All submissions are judged based on their creative and scientific merit, and no prior laboratory experience or specialized equipment is needed to apply. Selected winners have the unique opportunity to see their experimental designs launched to the International Space Station and conducted by astronauts. Additionally, finalists receive expert mentorship and specialized biotechnology equipment for their schools.

results.name: Mathematics Competition
results.title: HMMT
results.subtitle: Harvard, MIT, and nearby schools
results.description: Founded in 1998, HMMT is recognized as one of the largest and most prestigious high school mathematics competitions globally. Each tournament draws close to 1,000 students from around the world, attracting elite participants including top scorers from national and international olympiads. The organization is entirely run by students from Harvard, MIT, and other nearby institutions, many of whom are former competitors themselves. The program aims to encourage interest in math and engage a diverse community of students, helping them reach beyond traditional curriculums while offering insight into future careers in the field. Participants can engage with the organization through seasonal tournaments and various educational resources like archived problems and video guides.

results.name: High School Internship Program

deadlines.label: Public Service Scholars: Summer Semester before your senior year
Public Service Scholars: Fall semester of senior year
Public Service Scholars: Spring semester of senior year

results.title: Public Service Scholars: High School Internship Program
results.subtitle: John Glenn College of Public Affairs
results.description: The Public Service Scholars program is designed for Ohio high school seniors enrolled in The Ohio State University Academy to earn college credit while gaining practical experience. Participants take foundational coursework such as Introduction to Public Affairs or Civic Engagement before moving on to a supervised internship for credit. Students are responsible for securing their own internship placement within a public, nonprofit, or private organization that serves the public good. The curriculum requires at least 80 hours of service alongside professional development coaching and guidance from a career advisor. Coursework is delivered in various formats, including online options, to help students build professional skills for future success.

results.name: Information Technology Intern

Because of this lack of data, a comprehensive overview cannot be generated at this time.

results.name: Horticultural Science Summer Institute
results.title: Horticultural Science Summer Institute
results.subtitle: NC State Extension
results.description: High school students are invited to participate in a residential, hands-on, pre-college program designed to explore various career opportunities within the field of horticulture. Participants engage in faculty-led workshops covering topics such as breeding vegetables, grafting heirloom tomatoes, and lengthening the life of cut flowers. The program includes visits to innovative farms, markets, greenhouses, and gardens to broaden student interest and knowledge of sustainable production practices. Beyond technical skills, attendees explore college-making decisions and participate in leadership development and team-building activities while living in campus residence halls. This institute provides a close-knit forum for up to 42 students from across the country to investigate plant genetics and canopy management.

results.name: Health and Society Institute
results.title: Health & Society Institute
results.subtitle: Barnard Pre-College Programs
results.description: The Health & Society Institute is an academic program designed for rising high school juniors and seniors to investigate the complex relationships between science, medicine, and the social experiences of health. Participants explore critical topics such as the public health system, the rituals of healing, and the politics of surveillance through the perspectives of anthropologists, historians, and physicians. The curriculum combines theoretical concepts with practical qualitative research training, where students learn to develop research projects and conduct interviews with informants. Beyond the classroom, the program includes structured academic support through writing hours and faculty office hours, along with college-readiness sessions focused on time management and research skills. Students choose a specific course for the session and engage in depth through case studies, short research assignments, and data or fieldwork activities.

results.name: Drexel University
results.title: Neuroscience Camp for High School Students
results.subtitle: Drexel University College of Medicine
results.description: Drexel University College of Medicine offers a competitive program for motivated high school students with a strong interest in neuroscience and research. Participants learn fundamental concepts of neuroscience alongside basic laboratory techniques in molecular neurobiology, neurophysiology, and neuroanatomy through lectures and hands-on activities. The curriculum features live brain activity recordings, data analysis projects, and instruction in literature searching and project presentation. Applicants must be rising juniors or seniors with backgrounds in biology, chemistry, or research and are required to submit transcripts and two letters of recommendation for consideration. The program also includes field trips to scientific institutions and the opportunity to earn a certificate of completion upon finishing the camp.

results.name: Louisville High School
results.title: Camp Louisville - Summer Camp in Woodland Hills, CA
results.subtitle: Louisville High School
results.description: Camp Louisville invites rising 5th through 8th grade girls and boys to participate in an enriching summer experience focused on exploration, play, and creativity. The program features specialized weekly sessions including leadership training where students develop their confident voice through interactive games and communication exercises. Another week is dedicated to the arts, allowing campers to explore both visual and performing arts through activities ranging from canvas painting to stage performance. For those interested in technical fields, the engineering and robotics session provides hands-on experience with coding, building structures, and programming Lego puppy robots for a final competition. Participants are provided with a camp t-shirt and are encouraged to wear comfortable summer attire with closed-toed shoes for all hands-on activities.

results.name: Online Research Program
results.title: Summer Online Research Program
results.subtitle: UC Irvine School of Medicine
results.description: The Summer Online Research Program at the UC Irvine School of Medicine is a three-week mentored initiative designed to introduce high school students between the ages of 15 and 18 to professional research methods. Participants work under the guidance of medical faculty and college coaches to explore core concepts in evidence-based medicine and the responsible conduct of research involving human subjects. Throughout the session, students learn to critically evaluate medical literature and develop an organized research report with the potential to submit their work as a co-authored abstract to a national meeting. The program is conducted entirely online with a flexible schedule, utilizing email, Zoom meetings, and podcasts to deliver instruction and facilitate networking with undergraduate mentors. Applicants must maintain a minimum unweighted GPA of 3.3 and may apply for need-based scholarships if they come from underserved areas and meet specific income criteria.

results.name: Girls Talk Math Camp
results.title: Girls Talk Math Camp at the University of Maryland
results.subtitle: University of Maryland
results.description: The Girls Talk Math program invites rising high school freshmen through seniors who live within commuting distance to participate in an immersive academic experience centered on advanced numerical topics. This in-person camp engages participants in learning complex mathematical concepts that extend beyond the standard high school curriculum through mini-lectures and collaborative group work. A core component of the curriculum involves students researching a notable female mathematician to record and publish an original podcast highlighting her life and professional contributions. The program also features special enrichment events including panels and interviews where students can interact directly with professional women mathematicians to learn about diverse career paths. This inclusive initiative encourages participation from all students and aims to foster a deep interest in mathematics through hands-on learning and digital media production.

results.name: Summer Language Institute
results.title: Pre-College Summer Language Institute
results.subtitle: UChicago Summer Session
results.description: The Pre-College Summer Language Institute offers advanced high school students in 11th and 12th grade the opportunity to complete an entire year of a language alongside current university students. Participants can choose from modern or ancient languages, including French, German, Japanese, Spanish, Ancient Greek, and Latin. These intensive courses provide 300 units of credit, which is equivalent to three quarter-long courses and requires at least 90 contact hours. Beginning and intermediate tracks focus on developing comprehensive proficiency across speaking, listening, reading, and writing skills. The application process requires a teacher recommendation, a high school transcript, and a short essay, with financial aid available for qualifying applicants.

results.name: Summer Session
results.title: Pre-College
results.subtitle: University of California, Santa Barbara
results.description: UC Santa Barbara Summer Sessions offers premier pre-college programs designed for high school students to earn college credit while engaging in interdisciplinary research. The offerings include the Research Mentorship Program (RMP) and the Summer Research Academies (SRA), which allow participants to discover new knowledge through university-level projects. These programs are specifically structured to shape each student's academic, professional, personal, and social development within a challenging university environment. By immersing themselves in these transformative summer experiences, students hone the skills necessary to excel in higher education and gain a competitive edge in their future academic pursuits.

results.name: University of Louisville
results.title: Summer Internship Program
results.subtitle: Brown Cancer Center
results.description: The Summer Internship Program at the Brown Cancer Center provides students with the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in specialized cancer research laboratories. Interns work alongside a dedicated team of basic and translational researchers to explore the discovery and implementation of advanced cancer treatments. The experience covers a diverse range of scientific programs, including immuno-oncology, experimental therapeutics, and pancreatic cancer research. Participants may also utilize state-of-the-art core facilities that focus on disciplines such as bioinformatics, genomics, and medicinal chemistry to support ongoing research projects.

results.name: UNCG
results.title: Summer Arts and Design Camp
results.subtitle: UNC Greensboro
results.description: The Summer Arts and Design Camp is a one-week residential art program offered for up to 100 high school artists in grades 8 through 12. Mentored by faculty from the School of Art and the Department of Media Studies, student artists explore diverse disciplines including drawing, painting, printmaking, sculpture, photography, graphic design, animation, and filmmaking. The curriculum features faculty-led studio sessions that blend traditional techniques with contemporary experimentation to support unique creative journeys. Participants engage in enrichment activities such as artist talks, gallery visits, and career seminars on the arts. Students also have access to evening open studio sessions supervised by staff and preservice art teachers to work on independent projects. The program concludes with a student art exhibition at the Gatewood Gallery to celebrate the artistic achievements of the participants with their community.

results.name: FtRi Research
results.title: Fast-track Research Immersion Program
results.subtitle: Binghamton University
results.description: The Fast-track Research Immersion Program is a research-intensive, structured, and mentored experience designed to provide students with the skills and discipline content knowledge built during the first two semesters of the First-year Research Immersion program. This program is specifically geared toward STEM majors who have completed at least one year of college, including introductory science, math, or engineering courses, and are seeking an intensive research experience. Participants engage in a four-credit course involving a full-time commitment of 40 hours per week, covering research methods, theory, techniques, protocols, and data management. Students work inter-dependently in teams of three to five to investigate a research question related to an overall objective overseen by a Research Educator and faculty members. Successful completion of the summer program admits students to the third semester of the First-year Research Immersion program in the following fall, where they apply their skills to conduct experiments and present results at a public poster session.

results.name: HSRA Summer Program
results.title: Summer High School Research Academy
results.subtitle: The University of Texas at Austin
results.description: The Summer High School Research Academy (HSRA) provides high school students with an immersive and hands-on five-week interdisciplinary research experience. Participants engage in active College of Natural Sciences laboratories to explore various fields including biochemistry, genetics, neuroscience, genome engineering, and data analytics. Throughout the program, students collaborate with peers, undergraduates, and faculty members while learning cutting-edge techniques and gaining insights into life as a professional scientist. Each participant earns NSC309 UT extension course credit and presents a printed research poster at a concluding research symposium. Eligibility is prioritized for Texas residents who are rising sophomores, juniors, or seniors, and need-based scholarships may be available for qualifying students.

results.name: AMRI Research Program
results.title: AMRI High School Summer Research Program
results.subtitle: The University of New Orleans
results.description: The AMRI High School Summer Research Program offers an 8-week full-time experience for high school students to work side-by-side with nationally and internationally recognized scientists in modern research laboratories. Participants engage in fundamental and applied research projects covering diverse fields such as chemistry, physics, materials science, engineering, and mathematics. Students may work independently on their own assigned research programs or collaborate as part of a larger team on major focus areas of the host research group. In addition to intensive laboratory work, the program includes weekly seminars and tutorials on topics including ethics, laboratory safety, and professional management skills. Recent project topics have explored nanomaterials, 3-D printing, battery materials, neuroscience, and computer modeling to provide a comprehensive STEM experience. Eligible applicants receive a stipend for their participation while gaining valuable exposure to careers in materials science and related scientific disciplines.

results.name: Start Your Journey in Medicine Here
results.title: Medicine: An Inside Look At Treating Patients
results.subtitle: Georgetown University
results.description: Medicine: An Inside Look At Treating Patients is a pre-college course offered by Georgetown University for students aged 13 and up who are interested in pursuing a medical career. Participants explore the patient journey through three specific case studies involving kidney transplants, peripheral vascular disease, and cancer treatments while learning about the multidisciplinary roles within a healthcare team. The curriculum features video lectures from physician specialists, simulations, and curated assignments that total approximately 20 to 30 hours of instruction. Students receive guidance from experienced mentors throughout the program and culminate their experience with a Final Capstone Project where they design an ideal healthcare team for a specific patient scenario. Upon successful completion of this 100% online, flexible program, students earn a Certificate of Completion from the university.

results.name: Summer Intensives
results.title: Summer Intensives
results.subtitle: UCLA
results.description: Summer Intensives offer an accelerated learning environment where students can complete ten-week academic courses in a condensed three-week format. Participants have the opportunity to earn full course credits through immersive study, allowing them to advance their academic progress efficiently during the summer term. The program features a diverse selection of coursework, ranging from intensive language studies and writing workshops to film production and social science research methods. Enrollment is open to current UCLA students as well as visiting domestic and international students, with registration procedures and fees varying by student classification.

results.name: Exploring Frontiers
results.title: Exploring Frontiers
results.subtitle: University of Chicago
results.description: Current 10th-grade students who are at least 14 years old and reside in California or the New York metropolitan area are invited to participate in this intensive one-week residential enrichment program. Participants engage with leading faculty through readings, lectures, and hands-on applications that bridge multiple disciplines, including Economics, Neuroscience, and Physics. The curriculum introduces students to the institution's distinctive Core Curriculum while exploring specific subjects such as policy implementation, ancient Greek thought, and black holes. Prospective students must submit a complete application consisting of a transcript, two short essays, a letter of recommendation, and a writing sample. Significant financial aid is available, including full program fee waivers and travel support for eligible domestic students based on household income.

results.name: CLIP Leadership & Innovation
results.title: Resident Life
results.subtitle: International House at UC Berkeley
results.description: The Resident Life program fosters respect, understanding, and lifelong friendships through intercultural curiosity and exchange among its diverse community. It offers numerous leadership opportunities and specialized programs designed to cultivate inclusive global leadership skills for a more peaceful world. Residents can participate in dynamic community events such as the International Culture Festival, Sunday Suppers, and organized trips. Beyond social activities, the office facilitates social impact opportunities including the Davis Projects for Peace and various service awards. Communication is maintained through a dedicated resident portal and a weekly newsletter that keeps the community updated on recent developments and upcoming programs.

results.name: UMiami Health
results.title: High School, Undergraduate and Post-Baccalaureate Students
results.subtitle: Sylvester Comprehensive Cancer Center
results.description: Sylvester’s Office of Education and Training sponsors a variety of programs to increase cancer research career exploration for high school, undergraduate, and post-baccalaureate students. High schoolers can participate in research volunteer opportunities during summer months, while the SPARK program offers University of Miami undergraduates multi-year laboratory, computational, and clinical research experiences for credit or stipends. The SURF and CREATE initiatives provide intensive ten-week summer training fellowships focused on biomedical science and oncology for college students, often including mentorship from world-class faculty. Additionally, the American Cancer Society supports specific internship and post-baccalaureate programs aimed at strengthening the biomedical workforce through hands-on research and career development activities. Interested candidates must typically meet specific eligibility criteria, such as maintaining strong academic records in science and math or committing to multiple semesters of laboratory work.

results.name: WIE Rise Summer Research
results.title: WIE RISE! An Introduction to Engineering Research (Virtual)
results.subtitle: A. James Clark School of Engineering, University of Maryland
results.description: WIE RISE! An Introduction to Engineering Research (Virtual) is a program for rising 9th through 12th-grade students hosted by current Maryland Engineering students in partnership with the Women in Engineering Program. Participants explore various engineering disciplines, including Aerospace, Bioengineering, and Materials Science, through virtual lab tours and demonstrations of current university research labs. The curriculum introduces students to the core components of scientific research papers and includes asynchronous, at-home friendly experiments. This virtual experience requires a computer with high-speed internet and a webcam for synchronous live sessions conducted on Zoom. The application process operates on a rolling basis and requires prospective students to submit a statement regarding their interest in the field of engineering.

results.name: College Prep Program
results.title: College Prep Program
results.subtitle: Northwestern University
results.description: Northwestern College Prep offers high school students a variety of academic tracks, including two-week on-campus IN FOCUS seminars, self-paced online certificate programs, and undergraduate courses for college credit. These programs cover specialized fields such as Clinical Neuroscience, Forensic Chemistry, and Aerospace Engineering, all taught by affiliated faculty and instructors. Participants experience authentic college life by living in campus dorms, managing their own schedules, and engaging in discussions with motivated peers from across the globe. By participating, students gain crucial insights into potential majors and careers while building the skills necessary for future success in a university environment.

results.name: CURE - Summer Only
results.title: CURE - Summer Only
results.subtitle: Dana-Farber / Harvard Cancer Center
results.description: The Continuing Umbrella of Research Experiences (CURE) Program is a full-time, paid research internship designed for students interested in pursuing careers in scientific research. Participants engage in mentored cancer research projects where they acquire technical skills and foundational knowledge through hands-on experience and real-world application. The program features scientific skills training, research seminars, journal clubs, and professional development opportunities such as career exploration and networking with leading scientists. Eligible applicants include high school sophomores, juniors, and seniors, as well as college students in their first three years of study. Students conclude their internship by writing a scientific abstract and presenting their findings at a final presentation event.

results.name: High School Summer Program
results.title: Career Edge - NYU High School Summer Program
results.subtitle: NYU SPS High School Academy
results.description: Career Edge - NYU High School Summer Program is a premier college readiness initiative designed for students who have successfully completed grades 9, 10, or 11. Participants choose from various one-week courses to explore both traditional and emerging career paths while experiencing life at a renowned university. The curriculum focuses on professional immersion through projects, short assignments, guest lectures, and field trips to industry-related companies. Although these courses do not offer college credit, they provide valuable takeaways that prepare students for college-level classroom work and professional environments. Applicants must submit an online application, a 250-500 word essay explaining their course interest, and an official high school transcript to be considered for admission.

results.name: KU Cancer Center

program_dates.label: ACE High School Summer Research Program

results.title: Accelerate Cancer Education (ACE) High School Summer Research Program
results.subtitle: The University of Kansas Cancer Center
results.description: The Accelerate Cancer Education (ACE) program provides a six-week paid summer research experience designed for high school students interested in exploring biomedical careers and oncology. Participants engage in hands-on laboratory, clinical, or office-based projects while being paired with a faculty mentor to gain deep insights into cancer research. To be eligible, applicants must be current high school juniors or seniors with a minimum 3.0 GPA who are legally authorized to work in the United States and are at least 16 years old. Upon successful completion of the program, students present their findings at a poster forum and receive a stipend of $2,940 for their participation and contributions.

results.name: PSU
results.title: Penn State EnvironMentors
results.subtitle: The Pennsylvania State University
results.description: High school students interested in STEM research can join the Penn State EnvironMentors program to develop new skills and work alongside undergraduate and graduate mentors. Participants commit to regular meetings throughout the month to develop a specific research project under the guidance of university mentors. The program culminates in a mandatory Research Symposium where students showcase their findings and present posters to the community. Beyond the research component, the experience includes various educational activities and field trips designed to change the narrative in STEM for underrepresented students. Prospective mentees must obtain parent or guardian permission to participate in the application process and all subsequent program events.

results.name: Earth & Mineral Science Exposition

program_dates.label: EMEX 2026 March 28 Activities (Offered and Exploratory Students)

results.title: EMEX
results.subtitle: College of Earth and Mineral Sciences
results.description: The Earth and Mineral Sciences EXposition (EMEX) serves as the annual student-run Open House for the College of Earth and Mineral Sciences. This event welcomes high school students, current Penn State students, and transfer students who are interested in pursuing an EMS major. The program schedule is designed to accommodate both students who have already received an offer of admission and exploratory students looking to learn more about the college. Participants can explore various academic departments including Geosciences, Materials Science and Engineering, and Meteorology and Atmospheric Science to better understand the research and educational paths available.

results.name: SpHERES
results.title: SpHERES High School Research Program
results.subtitle: Carle Illinois College of Medicine
results.description: The SpHERES High School Research Program, also known as Sparking High Schoolers' Excitement for Research in Engineering & Science, allows students to collaborate with research faculty and mentors on an authentic research project. Participants explore the intersection of medicine, science, and engineering while gaining exposure to clinical skills, innovation, and entrepreneurship. The curriculum includes weekly seminars focused on college readiness, professional development, and holistic inclusive care to help students prepare for future healthcare careers. Scholars benefit from multiple layers of mentorship from faculty, medical students, and physicians, and they receive a summer stipend upon completion of the program.

results.name: Sustainable Food and the City
results.title: Plate + Planet Lab
results.subtitle: Barnard Pre-College Programs
results.description: Barnard’s 3-Week Plate + Planet Lab introduces students to the U.S. food system by examining food production, distribution, consumption, and waste management. Participants explore four key lenses including agriculture, health and justice, food systems and climate change, and soil health through hands-on learning from farmers and industry experts. This program is open to rising high school sophomores, juniors, and seniors who wish to research food policies, analyze food recovery efforts, and evaluate the impact of climate change on agriculture. Students conclude the experience by choosing a specific unit of interest to culminate in a final project that imagines an ecologically mindful food system.

results.name: Vanderbilt University
results.title: Summer High-School Internships in Research Experiences (SHIRE)
results.subtitle: Vanderbilt University
results.description: The Summer High-School Internships in Research Experiences (SHIRE) is a paid internship program offered in partnership with the Ayin Project and the Nashville POWER Youth Summer Employment Initiative. Open to rising juniors and seniors within the Interdisciplinary Science and Research (ISR) programs, this initiative allows students to work alongside scientists from Vanderbilt’s Collaborative for STEM Education and Outreach and educators from their home schools. Participants engage in hands-on research and skill development, with rising juniors exploring fields such as Cancer Biology and Sustainable Engineering through cell culturing and water quality studies. Rising seniors focus on developing individual research projects that they continue into the fall semester at their respective high schools. In addition to receiving a stipend, interns benefit from professional communication practice and insights from various guest speakers, including industry experts from Regeneron Pharmaceuticals.

results.name: Summer Academic Research Experience
results.title: Summer Academic Research Experience
results.subtitle: Johns Hopkins School of Medicine
results.description: The Summer Academic Research Experience (SARE) is a rigorous eight-week internship designed for high school students from low-income and educationally under-resourced backgrounds to explore the field of biomedical research. Scholars engage in hands-on projects within professional laboratories while receiving tutoring and taking advanced courses in scientific writing, mathematics, data analysis, and bioethics. The program is built upon four primary pillars including mentoring, professionalism, research, and academic fortification, all aimed at sharpening critical thinking and laboratory skills. Participants work alongside doctoral students or postdoctoral fellows and have the opportunity to become co-authors on scientific publications. Students who successfully complete the requirements of the program receive a $3,000 stipend in recognition of their efforts and achievements.

results.name: CMM Math Tournament
results.title: Caltech Math Meet
results.subtitle: Caltech
results.description: The Caltech Math Meet is a comprehensive competition that invites both teams and individual participants to engage in several challenging rounds. The event structure includes a virtual Power Round conducted before the main gathering, followed by in-person Team and Individual rounds. In addition to the core competition, attendees can participate in optional activities such as an Integration Bee, admissions events, and faculty lectures or math talks. Registration involves a fee of $120 per team or $20 for individual entries, with the package including breakfast, lunch, and promotional items like t-shirts from sponsors. Organizers recommend that a coach or legal guardian handles the sign-up process and accompanies student teams to the event to ensure proper supervision.

results.name: Pre-College Studies
results.title: Precollege Studies
results.subtitle: Cornell SCE
results.description: The Precollege Studies programs are open to rising juniors and seniors from any high school worldwide who are intellectually curious and academically motivated. Students can select from various program formats including residential, online, and commuter options to engage in rigorous university coursework. These offerings allow students to take college-level courses and experience the challenges of a higher education curriculum before graduating high school. The application process requires students to select courses quickly as they fill up, and the institution provides resources for international students as well as aids and accommodations for students with disabilities.

results.name: Bound Summer Program
results.title: Dartmouth Bound: Summer Program
results.subtitle: Dartmouth College
results.description: Dartmouth Bound: Summer Program is a comprehensive outreach initiative designed to provide rising high school seniors with an immersive experience of daily life at a top-tier institution. The program specifically targets students from underserved communities, including first-generation college students, those from low-income families, and students from rural or under-resourced high schools. Participants engage in intensive workshops led by admissions and financial aid officers, where they learn about individualized review processes and navigate the complexities of college funding through a mock admissions committee exercise. Beyond administrative guidance, the curriculum includes interaction with faculty members through class-setting environments focused on leadership, research, and contemporary global issues. Selected students receive full sponsorship from the college, which covers all travel expenses, housing in residence halls, and meals for the duration of the program.

results.name: Destination Imagination Challenge
results.title: Challenge Experience
results.subtitle: Destination Imagination
results.description: The Challenge Experience is the flagship program for students from pre-K through the university level, focusing on project-based STEAM learning. Small teams of two to seven members select a long-term Team Challenge from categories such as technical, scientific, engineering, and fine arts. In addition to their main project, participants practice Instant Challenges that require rapid ideation and critical thinking to solve quick tasks. Adult Team Managers facilitate the process without interfering in the students' solutions, ensuring that all work is entirely student-led. This multi-disciplinary program operates in various settings including schools, homeschool co-ops, and community clubs to help youth develop innovation and problem-solving skills.

results.name: UK College of Medicine
results.title: Summer Research Training Fellowship
results.subtitle: UK College of Medicine Department of Microbiology, Immunology, and Molecular Genetics
results.description: The Summer Research Training Fellowship is designed for outstanding high school students with a strong interest in science and advanced coursework in biology and chemistry. Participants are directly involved in experimentation, working under the supervision of a graduate student, post-doctoral fellow, or research scientist to apply classroom concepts to modern research questions. Students gain background knowledge through assigned readings and training in experimental techniques, often reaching a level where they can perform independent experiments. At the conclusion of the program, participants are expected to deliver a short oral presentation regarding their research findings to members of the department. To be eligible, applicants must be at least 16 years old and possess an active bank account for electronic deposit of fellowship funds.

results.name: JumpstART

program_dates.label: Visiting Artists Kristen Diederich and Kaitlyn Carr

results.title: JumpstART
results.subtitle: Oregon State University
results.description: JumpstART is a one-week precollege art experience designed for students in grades 9 through 12 who want to develop creative skills in a university-level environment. Participants receive hands-on instruction from professional artists and alumni in diverse studio disciplines such as drawing, painting, sculpture, graphic design, and photography. The daily schedule consists of two three-hour studio sessions along with visiting artist lectures that introduce students to various artistic practices and career pathways. Beyond the classroom, students participate in organized evening activities like task parties and cosmic bowling, culminating in a final gallery exhibition and awards ceremony for family and friends. Both overnight and day camp options are available, with meals provided in university dining centers and supervision maintained by staff and residential assistants throughout the program.

results.name: Summer STEM Internships
results.title: Summer Programs
results.subtitle: Keck Graduate Institute
results.description: Keck Graduate Institute offers a variety of summer programs designed to help prospective students strengthen their skills and prepare for careers in the biotechnology and healthcare fields. These programs range from one to eight weeks in duration and include opportunities for high school and undergraduate students to engage in cutting-edge research, explore the commercialization of scientific discoveries, and learn about precision medicine. Participants can gain practical experience in areas such as molecular biology, bioengineering, computational biology, drug discovery, and pharmacy through interactive classes and activities. The curriculum focuses on enhancing academic qualifications while developing critical thinking, problem-solving, and leadership skills within a dynamic and supportive learning environment.

results.name: Botball Scholarship Competition
results.title: Botball Educational Robotics
results.subtitle: KISS Institute for Practical Robotics
results.description: The Botball Educational Robotics Program engages middle and high school students in a hands-on, team-based competition where they design, build, and program fully autonomous robots. Participants use real engineering and coding skills in C, C++, or Java to navigate game challenges without the use of remote controls. Each team works with a standardized kit containing motors, sensors, and a camera, ensuring a level playing field without the need for specialized power tools. Throughout the season, students document their progress via a team home base, collaborate with a global community of roboticists, and prepare their robots for regional tournaments.

results.name: New York Bioforce
results.title: New York Bioforce
results.subtitle: Hypothekids
results.description: New York Bioforce offers comprehensive science research training designed for NYC public and charter high school juniors and seniors from low-resource backgrounds. Participants receive 50 hours of hands-on instruction in molecular biology, biomedical engineering, data science, and professional skills such as resume building and interview preparation. Following this training phase, students are placed into six-week paid summer internships at prestigious academic labs, life science companies, or health care institutions. The program culminates in a public poster session where students present their research findings to the community. This initiative aims to prepare the next generation of scientists and healthcare professionals by providing pathways to success in high-tech STEAM industries without requiring prior research experience.

results.name: How Cells Ensure Accurate Chromosome Segregation Internship
results.title: How Cells Ensure Accurate Chromosome Segregation and Avoid Aneuploidy (Maresca Lab)
results.subtitle: University of Massachusetts Amherst
results.description: This competitive research intensive program invites high-achieving rising high school sophomores through seniors to work in professional laboratories alongside distinguished faculty and graduate students. Participants investigate the fundamental mechano-molecular mechanisms of cell division, focusing on topics such as spindle assembly and chromosome movement to better understand diseases like cancer. Students gain hands-on experience with advanced methodologies, including fluorescence microscopy, PCR, DNA transformation, and Gibson assembly cloning techniques. Participants contribute to ongoing research studies and earn six college credits for their academic engagement in the lab. The program concludes with a formal poster session where students present their research findings to faculty, peers, and family members.

results.name: Teen Internship Program
results.title: Summer Teen Internship
results.subtitle: DOROT
results.description: The Summer Teen Internship provides high school students with the opportunity to volunteer and make a difference in the lives of older adults. Interns join a cohort of peers to help build a vibrant intergenerational community through specialized programs like Intergenerational Chess and GENuine Connections. Participants gain important leadership skills and build meaningful friendships while sharing their unique skills and knowledge. This program focuses on fostering connections across generations and allows volunteers to engage with seniors in person, online, or by phone.

results.name: Summer Surgery Program
results.title: Summer Surgery Program | Better Than Live
results.subtitle: UC Irvine Department of Urology
results.description: The Summer Surgery Program | Better Than Live offers students an immersive experience designed to stimulate interest in surgery, medicine, and related healthcare fields. Participants gain firsthand exposure to the realities of a surgical lifestyle while observing live procedures performed by top surgeons using advanced minimally invasive technologies like the da Vinci robot. The curriculum includes hands-on workshops where students practice open, laparoscopic, and robotic surgical skills alongside dissection courses and ultrasound training. Beyond clinical observation, students are challenged to identify surgical inefficiencies and develop their own medical innovation projects to improve patient safety and care. Additionally, attendees interact directly with medical professionals at every level of training and complete requirements to obtain Basic Life Support (BLS) certification.

results.name: Sequencing Your Genome Camp

deadlines.label: Refund Notification Deadline (Full refund minus admin fee)

results.title: 2026 Genome Camp
results.subtitle: miRcore
results.description: The 2026 Genome Camp is an intensive program designed for academically motivated high school students aged 16 and older as well as college students interested in computational genomics. The curriculum is structured into three distinct modules that progress from foundational computational biology and disease research to biotechnology sequencing and the personalized analysis of one's own sequenced genome. Participants gain hands-on experience using professional tools and databases, including machine learning packages for blood type prediction and the University of Michigan’s high-performance computing cluster for Linux-based calculations. Applicants must have completed a high school biology course and must submit their own DNA for non-medical research purposes to participate in the final self-data analysis portion of the camp. Beyond technical skills, the program explores various career paths including academics, law, and biotechnology business, culminating in group research presentations and business plan pitches.

results.name: Young Scholars Program
results.title: Young Scholars High School Program
results.subtitle: University of Pennsylvania
results.description: The Young Scholars High School Program enables high-achieving juniors at local schools to enroll in undergraduate courses and earn college credit. Participants can select from a wide range of subjects, including anthropology, economics, mathematics, and linguistics, all taught by university faculty and visiting scholars. Students are held to the same academic standards as undergraduate peers and typically earn one course unit per class, which translates to four credit hours. Access to world-class resources is included, such as the university library system and various academic support centers like the Marks Family Writing Center. High school students attending specific public or charter institutions may also qualify for tuition-free enrollment during the academic year.

results.name: Colgate University

deadlines.label: Health Insurance Enrollment or Waiver Deadline

results.title: Summer Before Colgate
results.subtitle: Colgate University
results.description: The Summer Before Colgate program is an intensive five-week Summer Institute designed for Office of Undergraduate Studies (OUS) scholars to immerse themselves in the university's rigorous academic culture. Participants enroll in two academic courses taught by university faculty, with a specific focus on developing critical reading, analytical writing, and quantitative literacy skills. The curriculum covers a broad range of subjects including the core curriculum, biology, and anthropology to strengthen scholars' academic skills before the formal start of their first semester. Beyond academics, the program facilitates community building by allowing students to form close relationships with faculty, staff, and peers while gaining exposure to a wealth of campus resources. The university further supports participants by covering the costs of tuition, books, supplies, and most meals during the duration of the institute.

results.name: Actuarial Science Camp
results.title: Actuarial Science Camp
results.subtitle: Lebanon Valley College
results.description: The Actuarial Science Camp is a week-long intensive program designed for rising high school seniors to explore potential careers in the actuarial field. Participants engage in an authentic industry experience that includes interactions with professional actuaries and an introduction to relevant software and specialized content. Applicants must have completed three years of high school and are required to submit an application along with a one-page recommendation letter from a mathematics teacher. Enrolled students reside in a college residence hall supervised by current actuarial science majors who serve as camp counselors to ensure a safe and collaborative environment. The program emphasizes the development of essential skills such as communication and programming while providing a clear look at the daily responsibilities and academic requirements of the profession.

results.name: Yale University
results.title: Yale Summer Enrichment Research Experience
results.subtitle: Yale Center for Clinical Investigation
results.description: The Yale Summer Enrichment Research Experience is a free six-week intensive program designed for undergraduate students currently enrolled in accredited institutions other than Yale who are pursuing careers in biomedical research. Participants are matched with a research laboratory at Yale to work on a primary project while engaging in weekly seminars, career discussions, and social activities to build critical thinking and scientific communication skills. The program aims to prepare students for the process of scientific discovery and the path toward successfully applying to PhD or MD/PhD graduate programs. Each student receives a stipend for their full-time commitment, which requires participation in lab work and academic sessions from Monday through Friday. Prospective applicants must submit a college transcript, a resume, a personal statement describing their goals and resilience, and two letters of recommendation, including one from a science faculty member.

results.name: Summer Session

deadlines.label: Session 2 Application Deadline (One full week prior to class start)
Session 3 Application Deadline (One full week prior to class start)
Session 4 Application Deadline (One full week prior to class start)
Session 5 Application Deadline (One full week prior to class start)

results.title: Summer Courses
results.subtitle: University of Maine
results.description: The Early College Summer Courses program provides high school students with the opportunity to earn University of Maine credits that satisfy general education requirements. Participants can choose from online, remote, or live course formats across various subjects including math, science, and leadership. The application process requires student and parent signatures along with school counselor approval through the ExplorEC portal at least one week before classes begin. Qualified Maine students may be eligible for tuition-free credits, while others can access courses at a significantly reduced tuition rate. Most science and math offerings include required lecture, recitation, and laboratory components, and some subjects may necessitate placement exams.

results.name: Visiting Owls
results.title: Rice Summer Programs
results.subtitle: Rice University
results.description: Rice Summer Programs provide a diverse range of educational and recreational opportunities for K-12 students and visiting college students. Visiting students can enroll in credit-bearing courses that may be transferred to their home institutions, while current university undergraduates can participate in approved study abroad programs. For younger participants, non-credit enrichment offerings include the STEM-LETICS Academy, various specialized sports camps led by university coaches, and youth activity programs focused on skill-building and teamwork. Additional academic year and summer initiatives include mentorship programs and preparatory music programs such as the Michael P. Hammond Preparatory Program. Participants across all sessions benefit from small class sizes and direct access to instruction from respected faculty members and subject-matter experts.

results.name: Summer Internship
results.title: High School Summer Internship Program
results.subtitle: Cincinnati Children's
results.description: The High School Summer Internship Program provides students with hands-on experience in pediatric biomedical sciences through shadowing and clinical or research projects. Participants are paired with primary mentors across diverse specialties such as human genetics, molecular cardiovascular biology, and pediatric orthopaedic surgery. Throughout the program, interns engage in professional development activities, including weekly networking luncheons and seminars with featured speakers from various medical fields. Students also participate in community service opportunities and hands-on training sessions using computerized simulated pediatric patients in a specialized SIM Center. The experience culminates with interns delivering a summary presentation of their unique activities during a graduation event.

results.name: The Knowledge Society
results.title: TKS
results.subtitle: TKS
results.description: TKS is a 10-month global accelerator for ambitious teens ages 13–17 that focuses on developing future-ready skills and mindsets. Participants explore cutting-edge fields such as artificial intelligence, biotechnology, and quantum computing while working on real-world projects with major companies like Google and OpenAI. The program provides access to a network of over 200 industry experts for one-on-one mentorship and connects students with a global community of like-minded peers from over 80 countries. Students train mental models like systems thinking and self-agency to solve complex problems, and alumni have gone on to build startups, join research labs, and earn internships at organizations like NASA and Google. The experience is available in both in-person and virtual formats with financial aid supported by various global foundations to ensure accessibility for all accepted students.

results.name: Summer Academics
results.title: Summer Academies
results.subtitle: Molloy University
results.description: Molloy University's Summer Academies are open to high school students entering their junior or senior year, as well as accepted incoming freshmen. Participants engage in interactive discussions, hear from guest speakers, and participate in hands-on activities led by faculty and student ambassadors while earning one college credit. The program offers specialized tracks including a Business Boot Camp, a Compassionate Healthcare Academy covering various clinical disciplines, and a Change Makers program for aspiring teachers and social workers. Students in the business track can participate in Shark Tank and trading competitions, while those in health sciences explore fields like cardiovascular technology and speech-language pathology. Attendees can choose between a residential experience with included meals and evening events or a commuter option that provides lunch.

results.name: Summer Actor Training
results.title: Summer Program 2026
results.subtitle: The American Academy of Dramatic Arts
results.description: The American Academy of Dramatic Arts offers the Summer Program 2026 for students looking to immerse themselves in professional dramatic training. Participants can explore various disciplines including motion pictures, television, musical theatre, and voice acting as part of their artistic development. The curriculum provides access to leading industry professionals through the Industry Insight Series, ensuring students receive relevant guidance for their future careers. Prospective attendees must complete an application and meet specific audition requirements to be considered for enrollment in these specialized courses. Detailed information regarding the full course catalog, scholarships, and international student resources is available for those interested in pursuing their passion for performance.

results.name: Space Physics Camp
results.title: Online Survey
results.subtitle: Qualtrics Experience Management™
results.description: This activity involves participating in an online survey designed for comprehensive data gathering and feedback. The platform is built using Qualtrics Experience Management™ to ensure a professional and streamlined user interface for all respondents. Individuals contribute to the program by providing digital responses to various prompts as part of a structured information-gathering process. This tool serves as a primary method for facilitating efficient communication and analysis across a range of research topics.

results.name: Communications Intern
results.title: Information Not Available
results.subtitle: Information Not Available
results.description: The provided source text does not contain any specific information regarding an extracurricular activity or its offering institution. Without descriptive content, it is not possible to extract the program's objectives, target audience, or specific curriculum details. No logistical information or subject-matter tags can be accurately identified based on the current loading state of the input. Please provide the relevant program details to receive a comprehensive and easy-to-skim informational summary.

results.name: NC State University
results.title: Online Research Academy (High School)
results.subtitle: Global Training Initiative
results.description: The Online Research Academy is an intensive, virtual program designed to transform high school students in grade 10 or higher into active researchers. Over the course of the curriculum, participants engage in direct mentorship with university faculty mentors to apply fundamental research methodologies to a dedicated, college-level project. Students can select from a wide range of interdisciplinary topics including computer science, textile engineering, financial mathematics, and social sciences to align with their personal interests. Upon successful completion of the program, participants receive a certificate and a professional evaluation letter from their professor to help them stand out in the competitive college admissions process. The experience requires a time commitment of five to ten hours per week and focuses on developing real-world skills in designing, executing, and presenting a substantial research project.

results.name: Learn What It Takes To Lead
results.title: Becoming a Leader: Motivate, Inspire, and Persuade
results.subtitle: Georgetown University
results.description: This online course is designed for students ages 13 and up who want to identify their unique leadership styles and practice effective communication tools. Participants explore topics such as conflict resolution, the dynamics of power, ethical decision-making, and the principles of persuasion through video lessons and multimedia simulations. The program includes 20 to 30 hours of total instruction and provides students with access to mentors for guidance on assignments and their final projects. For a fee of $1,895, learners will complete a Final Capstone Project involving a campaign presentation and earn a Certificate of Completion from the university upon finishing the course.

results.name: Scholars Program
results.title: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Global Learning
results.subtitle: Stanford University
results.description: The Stanford Pre-Collegiate Global Learning program provides distance-learning courses through the Stanford Program on International and Cross-Cultural Education (SPICE) for high school students. High schoolers located in the United States, Japan, and China are eligible to apply for courses that align with their individual interests. Students should carefully examine specific course descriptions and eligibility requirements prior to beginning the application process for these programs. The initiative aims to facilitate international and cross-cultural education through specialized curricula developed by university experts.

results.name: Youth Exchange Program

deadlines.label: New Students FAFSA and Scholarship Universe Application Deadline
Continuing Students FAFSA and Scholarship Universe Application Deadline

results.title: Youth Exchange Program (YEP)
results.subtitle: University of Montana
results.description: The Youth Exchange Program (YEP) is a transformative two-week summer adventure designed for twenty-four high school seniors to explore the core principles of democracy. Participants engage with politicians, nonprofit organizations, and community leaders to examine urban and rural perspectives while bridging societal gaps. This immersive experience empowers students to perform hands-on community service and learn from the leadership legacy of Mike Mansfield. Although the program is currently postponed due to funding cuts, it remains dedicated to fostering a deeper understanding of shared values among the next generation of leaders. The curriculum focuses on uncovering common ground and appreciating the unique traits that unite diverse communities through active engagement and civil discourse.

results.name: Junior Business Badgers
results.title: Online Survey Software
results.subtitle: Qualtrics Survey Solutions
results.description: The Online Survey Software provided by Qualtrics Survey Solutions offers a comprehensive environment for data-driven inquiry and research. Users can design and implement surveys to collect information from targeted audiences for analysis and reporting. The platform includes tools for managing response data and visualizing results to support informed decision-making. This resource is widely used in academic, commercial, and social science settings to facilitate high-quality research and evaluation efforts.
