This free outreach initiative requires a full two-week commitment and a formal application process, which includes a letter of recommendation and a strict prohibition on the use of AI in application materials.

results.name: Mercer University
results.title: Pharmacy Scholars Summer Program
results.subtitle: Mercer College of Pharmacy
results.description: Mercer University’s Pharmacy Scholars Summer Program (PSSP) is an educational opportunity designed for rising high school sophomores, juniors, and seniors interested in pharmacy or pharmaceutical sciences. This two-day program engages students with hands-on learning experiences and interactive activities led by current pharmacy students, faculty, staff, and alumni. The $125 participation fee covers all instruction materials, laboratory supplies, a program t-shirt, and transportation for field trips. In addition to the registration fee, participants must provide proof of current health insurance and submit signed permission forms to finalize their attendance.

results.name: MedAcademy
results.title: UCI MedAcademy
results.subtitle: UC Irvine School of Medicine
results.description: UCI MedAcademy is an immersive five-day day camp experience designed for high school students and recent graduates aged 15 to 19 who are interested in exploring medical careers. Participants engage in a variety of hands-on activities, including practicing medical resuscitation in a simulation center, learning suturing and ultrasound procedures, and interviewing standardized patient actors to reach diagnoses. The curriculum features medical lectures on topics like clinical reasoning and anatomy, leadership training from experienced faculty, and advocacy instruction focused on community health. Students gain insights into the life of a medical student through forums and build peer connections through team-building exercises and competitive puzzles. Admission requires an application including transcripts, a reference letter, and essay responses, with both partial and full scholarships available for those demonstrating financial hardship.

results.name: High School Honors

program_dates.label: Classes begin; residential and commuter orientation

results.title: High School Honors
results.subtitle: Boston University
results.description: High School Honors is a pre-college program at Boston University designed for students entering their junior or senior year. Participants select two undergraduate courses from a catalog of over 80 available offerings, studying alongside current university students and peers from around the world. Successful completion of these courses allows students to earn college credits that can be applied toward future academic pursuits. Participants benefit from access to world-class faculty, professional academic advising, and various university resources while experiencing authentic campus life. The program offers flexible learning formats, including residential, commuter, and online course options to accommodate various student preferences.

results.name: Georgia Tech

deadlines.label: The Carter Center Digital Democracy Fellow Application Deadline

results.title: Student Opportunities
results.subtitle: Institute for People and Technology
results.description: Georgia Tech undergraduate and graduate students can engage with the Institute for People and Technology through research teams, student assistant positions, and competitive fellowships. Student assistants work in tracks like research operations for technical troubleshooting or as lab assistants for prototyping and engineering projects. Summer research internships provide full-time opportunities to work on diverse projects including augmented reality for aircraft maintenance, IoT sensors for environmental monitoring, and human-centered design for individuals with mild cognitive impairment. Graduate students may specifically apply for the Carter Center Digital Democracy Fellowship, which integrates digital technology research with democratic processes. These roles allow participants to gain hands-on experience in software development, data analysis, and laboratory management while collaborating with industry partners and multidisciplinary faculty.

results.name: UCSF
results.title: School of Pharmacy
results.subtitle: University of California San Francisco
results.description: The School of Pharmacy offers academic programming across PharmD, Master's, PhD, and postdoctoral education to prepare students for careers as innovative leaders in pharmacy and precision medicine. The science-based curriculum integrates experiential study and interdisciplinary research, featuring specialized tracks like the Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence and Computational Drug Discovery and Development (AICD3). As a leader in therapeutic innovation, the institution has maintained the top position in competitive NIH research funding for over 45 consecutive years. Faculty and scholars across departments like Bioengineering and Pharmaceutical Chemistry work together to advance health by exploring fundamental biological mechanisms and developing effective treatments.

results.name: CAMINOS: Your Journey to College
results.title: Pre-College Program Application
results.subtitle: NC State University
results.description: NC State University provides a Pre-College Program Application designed for students interested in exploring academic offerings and campus life before formal enrollment. Through this program, participants can investigate a wide range of majors, minors, and pre-professional paths offered by various academic departments. The experience includes access to university resources such as student housing, dining, libraries, and career development centers to support future collegiate success. Managed by the Undergraduate Admissions office, the program utilizes the wolfPAW portal to help students navigate the application process and access important admissions facts. This initiative aims to provide high-impact experiences that prepare students for the transition to undergraduate study while introducing them to global engagement and distance education opportunities.

results.name: Berkeley Math Tournament
results.title: Berkeley Math Tournament
results.subtitle: Berkeley Math Tournament
results.description: The Berkeley Math Tournament is a student-led organization that aims to spread mathematics and the spirit of competition globally by presenting students with interesting, original, and hand-crafted problems. As the largest student-run math competition in the world, the program attracts over 4,000 annual participants from middle and high schools across the globe. The tournament offers teams of students the opportunity to share their interest in mathematics with like-minded individuals and explore concepts studied in higher mathematics. To ensure accessibility for all participants, the organization provides various formats, including a flagship high school tournament and a synchronous online version for those unable to travel.

results.name: Academic Immersion
results.title: Academic Immersion (AIM) High School Program
results.subtitle: Boston University
results.description: The Academic Immersion (AIM) High School Program is a three-week intensive course designed for students entering their junior or senior year who wish to dive deep into a specific academic subject. Participants can choose from several tracks, including Introduction to Experimental Psychology, Introduction to Medicine, Creative Writing, and Business. Each course curriculum combines traditional classroom work and theoretical studies with hands-on experiential activities such as lab work, simulations, and group projects. Students engage in interactive lectures, hear from guest speakers, and participate in field trips while experiencing a glimpse of college life. The program is available to both residential and commuter students, offering planned social activities and the opportunity to build connections with passionate peers.

results.name: Youth Employment Program
results.title: Summer Youth Employment Program (SYEP)
results.subtitle: Department of Youth & Community Development
results.description: The Summer Youth Employment Program (SYEP) is a large-scale initiative that connects New York City youth between the ages of 14 and 24 with paid work experience and career exploration opportunities. Participants in the program engage in structured project-based learning and work-based opportunities to help them prepare for future careers. The curriculum focuses on helping individuals develop productive workplace habits while strengthening their social, civic, and leadership skills. Through these diverse experiences, young people can explore various interests and career pathways in a professional environment.

results.name: High School Internship
results.title: High School Internship Program
results.subtitle: CliftonLarsonAllen
results.description: The High School Internship Program at CliftonLarsonAllen is designed for students aged 16 to 18 who are interested in exploring the worlds of business, professional services, and accounting. Participants gain hands-on experience by working on real projects and interacting with clients to understand the diverse opportunities available within the professional services industry. This paid summer opportunity allows interns to develop new professional skills, identify their personal strengths, and gain a head start on their career paths before pursuing further education. Students join a talent community that fosters an inclusive environment and provides a valuable introduction to the field of accounting through practical engagement.

results.name: Network For Teaching Entrepreneurship
results.title: Service Temporarily Unavailable
results.subtitle: Rutgers University
results.description: Rutgers University currently displays an error message indicating that a specific online service is temporarily unavailable for use. Users are advised to attempt their access request at a later time while the technical issues are being addressed. Contact information is provided for the Camden, Newark, and New Brunswick/Piscataway help desks to assist with any questions or suggestions during this downtime. Individuals can still access general information through the university's various campus websites which remain listed for reference.

results.name: Artificial Intelligence Internship
results.title: Summer Research Internship
results.subtitle: Center for Artificial Intelligence in Medicine & Imaging
results.description: The Summer Research Internship is a two-week virtual program designed for high school students entering grades 9 through 12 who are interested in exploring the technical and clinical aspects of AI in healthcare. Participants engage in a rigorous curriculum that includes technical lectures on AI fundamentals, mentoring sessions with Stanford researchers, and hands-on group research projects focused on solving practical medical problems. This project-focused experience also features "Meet the Expert" sessions with leaders from academia, industry, and government, as well as various social activities to build community. Eligible applicants must reside in the United States and demonstrate strong proficiency in mathematics or computer programming to thrive in this team-based digital learning environment. Upon successful completion of the full program, participants receive a Certificate of Completion acknowledging their training in medical AI research.

results.name: Artificial Intelligence Bootcamp

deadlines.label: AIMI Summer High School Programs Info Session

results.title: AIMI Summer Health AI Bootcamp
results.subtitle: Stanford University
results.description: The AIMI Summer Health AI Bootcamp is a virtual two-week educational experience designed for high school learners of all technical levels to explore the fundamentals of machine learning in healthcare settings. Participants engage in a curated curriculum that includes online learning modules, group discussions, breakout activities, and "Meet the Expert" sessions featuring speakers from academia, industry, and government. To be eligible, applicants must be residing in the United States, currently attending a U.S. high school, and be at least 14 years old by the start of the program. While no prior coding experience is required, there is a strong preference for students with math or computer programming skills who can commit to the full daily agenda. Upon successful completion of the entire program, students receive a formal Certificate of Completion acknowledging their training in health AI concepts and generative models.

results.name: UConn
results.title: Summer LEAD Program
results.subtitle: University of Connecticut
results.description: The Summer LEAD Program at the University of Connecticut is an enrichment initiative designed for high-achieving rising high school seniors from Connecticut to gain exposure to the collegiate environment. Participants engage in a non-credit residential experience where they attend sample classes, personal development sessions, and leadership skill-building workshops. The program provides comprehensive information regarding the college admission and financial aid processes while helping students build a peer network and connect with faculty and staff. All program expenses, including housing, meals, and activities, are fully covered for attendees, making the opportunity accessible to first-generation students and those from underserved populations.

results.name: Mayo Clinic
results.title: Science Program for the Advancement of Research Knowledge (SPARK) (Florida)
results.subtitle: Mayo Clinic College of Medicine & Science
results.description: The Science Program for the Advancement of Research Knowledge (SPARK) offers rising high school juniors and seniors the opportunity to engage in mentored research within world-class scientific laboratories. Participants gain hands-on experience in specialized fields such as biochemistry, cancer biology, neuroscience, and artificial intelligence while utilizing state-of-the-art facilities. Students are required to commit a minimum of 25 hours per week during their summer break and continue their engagement throughout the school year. Under the guidance of top researchers, scholars develop critical thinking skills and produce highly competitive projects suitable for entry into regional and state science fairs. The program emphasizes professional conduct and the real-world application of the scientific inquiry process to prepare students for future studies in science and medicine.

results.name: Pre-College
results.title: Pre-College
results.subtitle: University of California, Santa Barbara
results.description: UC Santa Barbara Summer Sessions offers two premier pre-college programs, the Research Mentorship Program (RMP) and the Summer Research Academies (SRA), designed for ambitious high school students. Participants have the unique opportunity to earn college credit while engaging in intensive interdisciplinary research alongside university experts. The curriculum is structured to shape each student's academic, professional, and personal development by immersing them in a challenging university environment. These transformative experiences help students discover new knowledge and hone the essential skills required to excel in future higher education endeavors.

results.name: Carver Summer Research Internship
results.title: George Washington Carver Internship Program
results.subtitle: College of Agriculture and Life Sciences
results.description: The George Washington Carver Internship Program invites students enrolled in the National Student Exchange program from participating schools to engage in an immersive semester-long research experience. Participants conduct impactful research alongside faculty mentors across various disciplines and explore the complexities of food systems and agricultural capacity building. Beyond laboratory and field work, the program offers personalized guidance to enhance student skills and professional development workshops to improve career prospects. Scholars receive a $8,000 stipend and a minimal travel allowance for the duration of the program. Applicants must submit two letters of recommendation to be considered for this opportunity, which provides valuable real-world exposure to the agriculture and food sectors while building a professional network.

results.name: National High School Institute

program_dates.label: Virtual Writing Workshop: Writing Comedy Workshop with Laura Schellhardt

results.title: National High School Institute
results.subtitle: Northwestern University
results.description: The National High School Institute provides gifted young people with immersive educational experiences across various creative and academic disciplines. Known affectionately as the Cherubs program, it stands as the oldest and largest university-based program of its kind. Students have the opportunity to enroll in specialized divisions focusing on Theatre Arts, Film & Video, Debate, and Playwriting. The curriculum is designed to foster an atmosphere of affection, knowledge, and trust by pairing outstanding students with superior teachers. This comprehensive program allows participants to explore their chosen crafts deeply through intensive tracks, electives, and hands-on production work guided by professional faculty.

results.title: High School Research Intern 2025
results.subtitle: The Echinacea Project
results.description: This paid summer field biology internship is designed for high school juniors and seniors who are interested in gaining hands-on research experience with tallgrass prairie plants and insects. Participants work alongside PhD scientists, graduate students, and college students to collect data on the ecology and evolution of the purple coneflower in fragmented prairie habitats. Interns engage in various field research activities, including identifying plants and insects, utilizing GPS and mapping techniques, collecting pollinating bees, and measuring specific plant traits. Each student also develops an independent research project under professional guidance to contribute to the project's broader scientific goals regarding prairie persistence. The program provides a weekly stipend and offers partial-to-full reimbursement for commuting costs for the duration of the internship. Candidates should possess fine motor skills, patience, and a strong interest in working outdoors in all weather conditions.

results.name: Camp Shule
results.title: Camp Shule
results.subtitle: Nyumburu Cultural Center
results.description: Camp Shule is a program that combines the fun, friendships, and adventure of a traditional camp with the excitement of intellectual inquiry and discovery. The curriculum provides an opportunity for youth to explore their academic, artistic, and athletic interests in a relaxed and creative environment. This experience is designed to encourage a life-long love of learning while fostering self-confidence, independence, and maturity. Students are empowered as decision-makers who choose their own daily schedules to help build their personal growth. For further inquiries or more information about participation, individuals may contact the program organizers directly via email.

results.name: SLE Summer Program
results.title: Summer Leaders Experience (SLE)
results.subtitle: West Point
results.description: The Summer Leaders Experience (SLE) is a highly competitive five-day immersion program designed for rising high school seniors interested in exploring the academic, military, and social life of a cadet. Approximately 1,100 students are selected based on academic, athletic, and extracurricular merit to participate in hands-on workshops, team-building exercises, and realistic military training. Attendees have the opportunity to customize their experience by choosing from various academic disciplines while receiving mentorship from current cadets and training for the Candidate Fitness Assessment. The program fee covers all lodging, meals, and supplies, though need-based scholarships are available to assist with costs. Participation provides students with firsthand insight into the character and leadership skills expected of members of the academy without obligating them to a formal future service commitment.

results.name: Law Academy
results.title: Law Academy
results.subtitle: Georgetown University School of Continuing Studies
results.description: The Law Academy offers high school students a comprehensive introduction to the American legal system through an exploration of jurisprudence, adjudication, and the administration of laws. Participants engage with expert faculty and legal professionals to examine contemporary issues such as constitutional law, criminal justice debates, and Supreme Court controversies. The curriculum features a mix of lectures, guest speakers, and discussion sections, complemented by hands-on experiences like participating in mock trials for hypothetical criminal cases. Students also explore various career paths within the legal field while benefiting from off-site visits and collaborative capstone projects. Upon successful completion of the program, which is available in both residential and commuter formats, participants receive a Certificate of Participation.

results.name: Medical Youth Science Program
results.title: Stanford Medical Youth Science Program
results.subtitle: Stanford Medicine
results.description: The Stanford Medical Youth Science Program is a five-week immersive enrichment program specifically designed for low-income, first-generation high school juniors residing in Northern California. This tuition-free initiative focuses on intensive health science and medicine to prepare students for future college and medical careers. Participants engage in an on-campus experience where they are mentored by medical professionals, university faculty, and college students passionate about science. The program aims to empower a cohort of like-minded peers who are motivated to become the next generation of health leaders. Through exposure to professional environments and specialized curricula, students develop as scholars while exploring the exciting world of medicine.

results.name: 1. My first activity
results.title: Medical Academy
results.subtitle: Georgetown University School of Continuing Studies
results.description: The Medical Academy introduces high school students to the diverse field of medicine through immersion in the Georgetown University Medical Center’s facilities and resources. Participants explore a wide range of academic topics, including human anatomy, cardiovascular physiology, radiology, surgery, and biomedical ethics. The curriculum features rigorous hands-on laboratory experiences such as small mammal dissection, suturing, orthopedic casting, and working with a patient simulator. Students also have the unique opportunity to interact directly with Georgetown University School of Medicine faculty, MedStar physicians, and current medical students to learn about medical school success and various specialties.

results.name: Pre-College
results.title: CCA Pre-College Program
results.subtitle: California College of the Arts
results.description: The CCA Pre-College Program invites a diverse group of creative thinkers and makers to join an inspiring community focused on art and design. This immersive program is open to all interested participants, ranging from those with very little experience to students with advanced artistic skills. Participants engage in studio-focused, college-level courses that challenge them to move beyond initial concepts to create portfolio-ready pieces. Students have the opportunity to earn three college credits while developing their creative voices alongside a dynamic ecosystem of artists and designers. To support the student experience, the institution provides on-campus housing and meal plans for both residential and commuter participants.

results.name: Georgia Institute of Technology
results.title: STEP Program at Georgia Tech
results.subtitle: Georgia Institute of Technology
results.description: The Science, Technology and Engineering Pipeline (STEP) program is a free summer camp where high school students explore the engineering design process through NASA-inspired challenges. Participants engage in a crash course led by aerospace engineering faculty and students, utilizing specialized maker spaces to bring their technical designs to life. The curriculum includes hands-on missions such as building autonomous rovers and modifying technology for future Mars exploration. Students conclude the experience by presenting their final designs to fellow campers, friends, family, and industry sponsors like Lockheed Martin. This initiative is supported by the Aerospace Systems Design Lab and the Georgia Space Grant Consortium to educate and inspire the next generation of engineers.

results.name: ASPIRE Scholars Program
results.title: Early Outreach
results.subtitle: University of Nevada, Las Vegas
results.description: UNLV Early Outreach offers college and career readiness programming specifically designed for K–10 students and their families. The initiative carries out its mission of “Raising Rebels” through a variety of community engagement opportunities including school visits, campus tours, and special events hosted throughout the year. The Young Rebels component provides unique academic and social enrichment to support college access while encouraging students to interact with university faculty and peers. Participants can engage in critical thinking exercises and build academically minded friendships while envisioning themselves in a higher education setting. The program also assists schools by participating in family nights, college fairs, and career days to help students navigate their future educational paths.

results.name: Stem-Rising
results.title: STEM for Rising 9th and 10th Graders
results.subtitle: Brown University
results.description: STEM for Rising 9th and 10th Graders is a 12-day program designed for students who have completed grades 8 or 9 and are passionate about advancing their knowledge in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. Participants choose from a variety of engaging courses that combine rigorous academic instruction with hands-on laboratory exercises, field work, and team-based research projects. Throughout the experience, students may engage with graduate students to learn about advanced research and will work together to tackle complex design-build challenges. The program concludes with a final presentation where students showcase their projects to peers, instructors, and family members. All successful participants receive a Digital Certificate of Completion and a Course Performance Report to recognize their academic growth and focus on learning without the pressure of formal grades.

results.name: TAMU
results.title: HPRC Summer Computing Academy
results.subtitle: Texas A&M High Performance Research Computing
results.description: The HPRC Summer Computing Academy offers a week-long cybersecurity program designed to engage students entering the 8th through 12th grades. Led by experienced computer science professionals, the curriculum focuses on building excitement and knowledge through a variety of educational activities. The primary goals of the initiative are to increase awareness of professional paths in cybersecurity and to support the growth of the future workforce in this field. While registration for the camp is free, prospective participants must submit an application as spots are limited and acceptance is not guaranteed.

results.name: UNM Health
results.title: CURE Program for Students
results.subtitle: UNM Comprehensive Cancer Center
results.description: The CURE Program for Students is a paid summer research training opportunity designed for high schoolers aged 16 and older and college undergraduates interested in cancer-related careers. Participants commit to a 40-hour work week where they engage in laboratory research, attend seminars, and work alongside faculty and near-peer mentors. The curriculum includes an introductory cancer course for high schoolers and professional development for college credit, focusing on topics like environmental health, genomics, and indigenous community screening attitudes. To conclude the program, students share their findings through a final creative presentation such as a research poster, painting, musical piece, or poem. This internship aims to equip students with essential skills in research design and data analysis while helping them navigate their future pre-health or scientific career paths.

results.name: Bowdoin College
results.title: Instrumental Program
results.subtitle: Bowdoin International Music Festival
results.description: The Instrumental Program provides an intensive and in-depth exploration of chamber and solo music for 250 students characterized by their dedication and passion for excellence. Participants receive weekly private lessons with esteemed faculty, attend studio classes, and participate in chamber music coachings twice per week. Performance opportunities are abundant, ranging from the Young Artist Series and community concerts to masterclasses and collaborations with student composers within a festival orchestra. Students typically between the ages of 15 and 30 benefit from a flexible schedule that includes composer lectures, seminars, and access to professional resources like HD video recordings of their performances. This summer institute aims to help young musicians realize their artistic passions while preparing them for meaningful professional lives in the arts.

results.name: Summer Academy for Math & Science
results.title: Summer Academy
results.subtitle: OSU-Cascades
results.description: High school students entering grades 10-12 can explore academic and career interests through immersive sessions led by university professors and industry experts. Participants select a specialized track such as Computer Science, Kinesiology, Outdoor Products, Art + Media + Technology, Natural Resources, or Political Science. The program structure balances morning academic lessons with afternoon recreational activities like hiking and rock climbing, alongside career exploration through off-campus employer tours and on-campus lab work. Students have the option to reside in on-campus residence halls or participate as day students, with both tracks including all meals, snacks, and access to campus fitness facilities. Upon completion of the program, each participant receives a five-hundred-dollar scholarship applicable toward future tuition at the institution.

results.name: Advance Pre-College Program
results.title: UVA Advance
results.subtitle: University of Virginia
results.description: UVA Advance is a credit-granting pre-college program designed for highly-motivated rising high school juniors and seniors. Participants engage in a residential experience where they take small, intensive classes taught by leading faculty members. Students have the opportunity to earn six transferable undergraduate credits while experiencing university life firsthand through academic and extracurricular activities. Beyond the classroom, participants gain access to various campus facilities including libraries, sports centers, and dining halls to help them prepare for success in higher education. This program also fosters a global community by allowing students to develop friendships with peers from across the country and around the world.

results.name: 3-Week Medical Academy
results.title: Medical Immersion Academy
results.subtitle: Georgetown University School of Continuing Studies
results.description: The Medical Immersion Academy offers high school students a snapshot of a first-year medical school curriculum through instruction from Georgetown University School of Medicine faculty and medical students. Participants study diverse topics such as cell biology, pathology, immunology, cardiology, and endocrinology while exploring the science behind how human body systems function. The program emphasizes fundamentals of emergency medicine, covering practical skills like wound care, stitches and suturing, airway management, and CPR. Students engage in a mix of class sessions, field trips, hands-on workshops, and labs, culminating in the creation of a research-based poster.

results.name: Lincoln Laboratory
results.title: Summer High School Internship Program
results.subtitle: MIT Lincoln Laboratory
results.description: The Summer High School Internship Program at MIT Lincoln Laboratory provides a unique opportunity for rising seniors to explore various STEM careers before they commit to a specific area of study in college. Participants are paired with professional Laboratory staff mentors to complete hands-on projects and solve technical problems within a professional laboratory environment. Throughout the duration of the internship, students develop both technical and interpersonal skills while gaining access to a wide range of the institution's technical and professional resources. This paid learning experience is specifically designed for local students who live and attend high school within the New England area.

results.name: Vanderbilt University
results.title: Interdisciplinary Science and Research Program
results.subtitle: Collaborative for STEM Education and Outreach
results.description: The Interdisciplinary Science and Research Program is a partnership between the Vanderbilt Collaborative STEM Education and Outreach and Metropolitan Nashville Public Schools designed to enhance student understanding of STEM concepts and research principles. This rigorous four-year program transitions participants from foundational scientific learning to performing independent research during their junior and senior years. Every course is co-taught by a scientist-teacher team focused on providing individualized instruction to meet the specific needs of each student. Participants are expected to be active, collaborative learners who engage in formulating questions, testing hypotheses, and presenting their findings at symposia or scientific conferences. Students also have unique opportunities for field trips, job shadows, and specialized study units such as the science of music.

results.name: ASP Summer
results.title: ASP Summer
results.subtitle: St. Paul's School
results.description: The Advanced Studies Program at St. Paul’s School is an immersive residential initiative designed for talented rising high school seniors and highly motivated rising juniors from New Hampshire. Participants engage in over fifteen thought-provoking major courses such as molecular biology, engineering, law and governance, studio arts, and data science, all within an environment that maintains an average class size of twelve. The curriculum extends beyond standard coursework to include a dedicated Writing Workshop and comprehensive college advising to help students feel confident about the upcoming application process. With a three-to-one student-to-faculty ratio, the program focuses on academic exploration and exposure to diverse career paths while fostering friendships among like-minded peers. This transformative five-week experience encourages students to become active citizens and big thinkers by tackling real-world problems and relevant ideas.

results.name: Sejong Korea Scholars Program
results.title: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Global Learning
results.subtitle: Stanford University
results.description: The Stanford Program on International and Cross-Cultural Education (SPICE) offers distance-learning courses for high school students interested in international and cross-cultural education. This program is open to students from the United States, Japan, and China, allowing them to choose courses that match their specific interests and eligibility. Prior to beginning the application process, all candidates should carefully review the descriptions and requirements for their chosen programs. The courses offer a way for high schoolers to gain academic experience in a cross-cultural context through distance education. Applicants are encouraged to pursue the learning opportunities that best fit their personal and academic backgrounds.

results.name: Civic Leadership Institute

program_dates.label: Intrepid by Design Workshop for Educators

results.title: Civic Leadership Institute
results.subtitle: Northwestern Center for Talent Development
results.description: The Civic Leadership Institute (CLI) is an intensive academic program for students in grades 9 through 12 that explores current social and political issues through service-learning and academic study. Participants engage in college-level coursework, dialogue with peers to identify diverse viewpoints, and partner with local non-profit organizations for hands-on service projects. The curriculum includes meetings with community partners, presentations from government and business leaders, and the development of an individualized action plan for social change under instructional mentorship. Upon completion, students receive a detailed narrative evaluation and certification of earned service hours to document their achievements and personal growth.

results.name: Summer Program
results.title: Canada/USA Mathcamp
results.subtitle: Canada/USA Mathcamp
results.description: Canada/USA Mathcamp is an intensive program designed specifically for mathematically talented students between the ages of 13 and 18. The program enrolls a diverse group consisting of approximately 65 new students and 55 returning alumni each session. Prospective participants must undergo a thorough and selective application process that includes a qualifying quiz, references, and a detailed review of their mathematical background. Students can access resources such as live online Q&A sessions and comprehensive information regarding scholarships to ensure the program remains accessible to all qualified applicants.

results.name: NURPH
results.title: Northwestern University Research Program for High Schoolers
results.subtitle: Northwestern University
results.description: The Northwestern University Research Program for High Schoolers provides high school students with the opportunity to engage in scientific research through a structured curriculum and professional mentorship. Eligibility is currently limited to sophomores, juniors, and seniors attending Chicago Math and Science Academy, Northwestern Academy, or Holy Trinity High School, with priority consideration given to junior applicants. Participants explore laboratory spaces and gain hands-on experience by completing research projects that culminate in the creation of academic posters. The application process requires prospective students to submit two essays, a high school transcript, a letter of recommendation, and a detailed list of extracurricular activities.

results.name: Robotics Competition
results.title: FIRST Robotics Competition
results.subtitle: FIRST
results.description: FIRST Robotics Competition is a STEM program designed for high school students in grades 9-12 to engage with industrial-sized robotics. Participants work in teams to design, program, and build robots using a provided Kit of Parts to compete in action-packed games on themed fields. Guided by adult mentors, students operate as part of three-team alliances to foster collaboration and the spirit of Coopertition. Beyond technical tasks, team members develop a brand identity, manage fund-raising efforts, and promote an appreciation for STEM within their local communities. The program emphasizes the development of critical workforce skills, helping students improve their problem-solving and engineering capabilities.

results.name: Harper Research Cures Cancer Corps
results.title: Research Cures Cancer Corps (RC3) Program
results.subtitle: Mike and Josie Harper Cancer Research Institute
results.description: The Research Cures Cancer Corps (RC3) Program provides high school freshmen, sophomores, and juniors with a rare opportunity to conduct immersive cancer research alongside university professors. Selected participants engage in a hands-on lab experience designed to enhance problem-solving and leadership skills through individualized mentoring and enrichment learning opportunities. This eight-week applied learning opportunity includes a $5,000 stipend for accepted scholars but does not offer high school or college course credits. The program aims to build a diverse pipeline for future careers in cancer research, requiring applicants to undergo an in-person interview process and provide recommendations from STEM educators.

results.name: OPTIMUS Research Internship
results.title: OPTIMUS
results.subtitle: Moores Cancer Center
results.description: OPTIMUS is an eight-week educational internship designed for tenth and eleventh-grade students from underrepresented backgrounds who are interested in cancer research. The program exclusively accepts applicants from several specific schools, including Lincoln, Hoover, Crawford, Morse, Madison, Garfield, Mark Twain, and Preuss High Schools. Participants engage in hands-on experiences by working in professional research laboratories and shadowing physicians within clinical environments to learn about oncology. The internship is facilitated by medical and graduate students, provides participants with a stipend, and requires adherence to institutional health and vaccination policies.

results.name: Cooper Union

deadlines.label: Scholarships and Financial Aid Deadline (NYC Public School Students)

results.title: Introduction to Architecture for High School Students Online
results.subtitle: The Irwin S. Chanin School of Architecture
results.description: The Introduction to Architecture for High School Students Online is a five-week intensive program offered to current high school students and recent graduates worldwide. This virtual curriculum focuses on architectural thinking, design principles, and the development of a professional portfolio through an iterative process involving radical experimentation with digital interfaces and virtual modeling. Participants engage in live synchronous sessions including lectures, workshops, and tutorials led by faculty to explore concepts of geometry, structure, and function. Students gain proficiency in digital tools such as Rhino, Photoshop, and Adobe Creative Cloud to translate their ideas into three-dimensional forms and physical models. Upon successful completion of all assignments and adherence to the code of conduct, students earn an official Certificate of Completion to support their college application process.

results.name: CS Scholars Pre-College
results.title: CS Scholars
results.subtitle: Carnegie Mellon University
results.description: CS Scholars is a fully funded, merit-based program designed for rising high school sophomores to engage in an immersive exploration of computer science through classroom instruction and hands-on projects. Participants dive into college-level curriculum covering Python programming, computational mathematics, and writing workshops focused on crafting personal statements for college admissions. The program emphasizes real-world application through group research projects, faculty mentorship, and industry engagement with tech companies, culminating in a public capstone symposium presentation. Beyond technical skills, scholars attend seminars on college admissions, financial aid, and social-emotional wellbeing while experiencing residential life and peer community-building activities. All program costs including tuition, housing, and meal plans are covered for admitted students, with a specific commitment to supporting those from underrepresented backgrounds or with demonstrated financial need.

results.name: Upward Bound
results.title: Upward Bound (UB)
results.subtitle: Penn VPSE
results.description: Penn Upward Bound (UB) is a comprehensive afterschool and summer college preparatory program designed for highly motivated high school students who are first-generation-to-college or from low-income backgrounds. Applicants must be in the 9th or 10th grade, maintain a minimum 2.5 GPA, and attend participating high schools such as Sayre, Overbrook, West Philadelphia, or Parkway West. The program provides a wide range of resources including academic support, digital literacy training, and intensive college, career, and financial aid advising. Participants benefit from a Summer Residential Program where they live on campus and take classes, alongside opportunities for community service, cultural field trips, and out-of-state college tours. To encourage engagement and success, the initiative also offers various incentives such as stipends, program swag, and leadership development.

results.name: Google CS Summer Institute
results.title: BuildYourFuture
results.subtitle: BuildYourFuture
results.description: BuildYourFuture is an educational initiative designed to help students and young professionals navigate their career paths and professional development. The program focuses on providing accessible resources and guidance that empower individuals to build a successful foundation for their upcoming endeavors. Participants can explore various growth opportunities and academic tools tailored to foster long-term skill acquisition and career readiness. By offering these structured insights, BuildYourFuture supports the next generation of leaders in achieving their personal and professional goals.

results.name: Northeastern University

program_dates.label: Bridge to Calculus/Bridge to Science (BtC/BtS) Learn and Earn

results.title: Northeastern C2C Summer Youth Jobs Program
results.subtitle: Northeastern University
results.description: The Northeastern C2C Summer Youth Jobs Program provides paid employment opportunities for Boston residents through two distinct pathways. High school students ages 14 to 18 can join the Bridge to Calculus and Bridge to Science programs, which offer advanced math instruction alongside enrichment in subjects such as physics, biology, robotics, and financial education. Interns in this track work up to 25 hours per week for a six-week duration, with preference given to rising juniors and seniors. Young adults between the ages of 19 and 24 can apply for SuccessLink Leader positions to provide mentorship, program evaluation, and administrative support for the younger cohort. These leadership roles involve up to 30 hours of work per week for eight weeks and include professional development and leadership training. Interested candidates must complete an online application and register through the BPS SchoolMint system to be eligible for selection.

results.name: Missouri University of Science and Technology
results.title: Future City: Electrifying Your Future
results.subtitle: Missouri University of Science and Technology
results.description: Future City: Electrifying Your Future invites students ages 14 through 18 to explore innovative solutions for sea level rise by designing sustainable floating cities. Participants engage in the Engineering Design Process and utilize project management skills to address real-world sustainability challenges. The curriculum includes hands-on activities such as learning to design and program in virtual reality to model future cityscapes. Attendees also benefit from touring the university's Eco Village and interacting with professional city planners and university faculty to gain insights into urban administration. This competitive camp has a capacity of 24 students and provides a comprehensive experience that includes all meals, housing, and necessary materials for the program fee.

results.name: Summer Academy
results.title: NYC Summer Academy
results.subtitle: The School of The New York Times
results.description: The NYC Summer Academy is an academically engaging pre-college program designed for high school students in grades 10 through 12, as well as graduating seniors, who are at least 15 years old by the start of the session. To apply, first-time applicants must complete an online submission that includes a short answer question, a non-refundable application fee, and their most recent school transcript. The school offers both residential and day attendance options, with flexible payment plans and a scholarship program available to support students from diverse financial backgrounds. Admissions are conducted holistically, seeking student leaders with diverse ambitions to join a community focused on understanding the world through high-level coursework and interaction with professional faculty. Non-native English speakers are required to provide proof of proficiency, while returning students benefit from a streamlined admission process upon completing specific enrollment agreements.

results.name: Online Pre-College Programs
results.title: Pre-College @ UMass Amherst
results.subtitle: University of Massachusetts Amherst
results.description: UMass Amherst offers a variety of pre-college opportunities for high school students including academic programs, research intensives, and college prep workshops. The programs are open to rising high school sophomores, juniors, and seniors, with specific tracks like Pre-Veterinary Medicine and Veterinary Technology reserved for juniors and seniors. Applicants must submit a written statement of interest, unofficial high school transcripts, and a letter of recommendation from a teacher or guidance counselor for most sessions. International applicants are required to provide proof of English language proficiency through standardized test scores if they do not attend an English-speaking high school. The application process also involves a non-refundable fee and strictly prohibits the use of generative AI tools for creating personal statements.

results.name: Computer Science and Informatics
results.title: The Computer Science and Informatics Research Experience (CSIRE)
results.subtitle: Stony Brook University
results.description: The Computer Science and Informatics Research Experience (CSIRE) is a research program designed for high-school students who are ready to move beyond textbooks and immerse themselves in real scientific inquiry. Participants collaborate directly with faculty and PhD mentors across various departments, including Computer Science, Biomedical Informatics, and Engineering, to contribute to original projects in fields such as machine learning and data science. Throughout the program, students gain hands-on experience by designing experiments, writing code, and interpreting results, while also attending specialized research talks and career seminars. This immersive experience often leads to publications and recognition in prestigious national competitions such as the Regeneron Science Talent Search, with many students continuing their lab involvement long-term.

results.name: Aerospace Academy
results.title: Aerospace Academy
results.subtitle: Envision by WorldStrides
results.description: This 12-day residential program is designed for high school students in grades 9 through 12 who are interested in flight technology and aerospace innovation. Participants engage in hands-on engineering challenges, such as building and launching model rockets and planning a satellite mission under a high-altitude weather balloon. The curriculum covers a broad range of subjects including aerodynamics, orbital mechanics, and the integration of artificial intelligence in flight systems. In addition to technical workshops on CAD software, robotics, and 3D printing, students develop leadership and social-emotional skills through collaborative team projects. The experience includes site visits to major aviation and space centers, provides college credit, and culminates in the creation of a portfolio-worthy mission documentary.

results.name: University Interscholastic League

deadlines.label: Barbara Jordan Historical Essay Competition Deadline
Wild Card Team Verification Final Deadline

results.title: Academics
results.subtitle: University Interscholastic League
results.description: The University Interscholastic League offers a comprehensive program of academic competition featuring 30 contests for high school students and 20 A+ Academic contests for grades 2 through 8. These activities are designed to complement the school curriculum, motivating participants to achieve higher levels of knowledge and mastery in specific skills while confronting important issues. More than half a million students participate annually in diverse categories including STEM, journalism, speech and debate, theatre, and various subject-specific academic meets. Participating students are challenged to think critically and creatively, with finalists in certain categories such as the essay competitions becoming eligible to apply for scholarships through the Texas Interscholastic League Foundation. The program encompasses a progression of competitions from invitational and district meets to regional and state championships, providing a structured platform for demonstrating academic excellence.

results.name: Rutgers University
results.title: The Goldman Group - LEEDAR - Summer Research Program
results.subtitle: Rutgers University
results.description: The LEEDAR Summer Research Program provides high school juniors and seniors with the opportunity to engage in scientific exploration within a university environment. Participants work one-on-one with professors to gain hands-on experience in a chemistry laboratory while learning about specific research projects. This initiative serves as a comprehensive introduction to the process of scientific research, helping students understand the professional academic experience. To apply, students must submit a detailed application including their academic credentials, research interests, and a personal statement. The experience is designed to help students build their resumes and gain valuable insight into the college environment and future scientific careers.

results.name: YES for CURE
results.title: YES for CURE
results.subtitle: Dana-Farber / Harvard Cancer Center
results.description: The Young Empowered Scientists for ContinUed Research Engagement (YES for CURE) Program is a comprehensive 2.5-year training initiative designed for highly motivated high school sophomores, juniors, and college freshmen or sophomores interested in pursuing careers in scientific research. Participants engage in hands-on, mentored summer research projects within professional cancer research labs and receive summer stipends for their contributions. Throughout the academic year, scholars attend advanced scientific seminars and professional development workshops to build essential skills like networking, molecular biology techniques, and the responsible conduct of research. Beyond laboratory work, students take on leadership roles by developing science curricula for middle school students and facilitating peer-led journal clubs to master scientific communication. The program also prioritizes family involvement by offering academic planning support and inviting family members to educational events to help them understand and support the students' research journeys.

results.name: Summer Scholars
results.title: Summer Scholars
results.subtitle: University of Notre Dame
results.description: Summer Scholars provides high school students with an intensive two-week experience taking a rigorous college-level course taught by university faculty. Participants benefit from small class sizes and personal attention while engaging in coursework that serves as a true preview of the college academic environment. The program offers a wide range of subjects including life sciences, engineering, law, and journalism, allowing students to explore their intellectual curiosities. Upon successful completion of a program track, students may earn one transferable college credit. Beyond the classroom, students collaborate on projects and enjoy the social facets of college life, including the opportunity to participate in community service projects.

results.name: Badger Summer Scholars

program_dates.label: Lead the Way Creativity and Critical Thinking (Session 1)
Medical Sciences: Human Anatomy and Pathology

results.title: Badger Precollege
results.subtitle: UNIVERSITY of WISCONSIN-MADISON
results.description: Badger Precollege offers a wide variety of in-person and online academic programs designed for students in grades 4–12 to explore their interests and future career paths. Participants can choose from specialized sessions such as the Accelerated Learning Program (ALP), the Summer Music Clinic, and the Summer Transitional Enrichment Program (STEP). The curriculum covers diverse subjects including forensic science, engineering models, veterinary medicine, and computer programming with Python. Depending on the selected course, students engage in hands-on activities like lab-based chemistry experiments, mock trial case studies, or collaborative theatrical workshops. Tuition costs vary based on residential or commuter status, and many sessions offer multi-session discounts for those attending multiple blocks of study.

results.name: Stanford E-Japan Program
results.title: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Global Learning
results.subtitle: Stanford Program on International and Cross-Cultural Education (SPICE)
results.description: The Stanford Program on International and Cross-Cultural Education (SPICE) offers distance-learning courses specifically designed for high school students. This academic initiative provides opportunities for participants to explore international and cross-cultural themes through specialized coursework. Students are encouraged to apply for the programs that best fit their individual interests and eligibility status. It is important for all prospective applicants to review the specific course descriptions and requirements thoroughly before starting the formal application process.

results.name: Intensive Law Program

program_dates.label: Intensive Law & Trial - Stanford University Session 1
Intensive Law & Trial - Stanford University Session 2
Intensive Law & Trial - Stanford University Session 3

results.title: Intensive Law & Trial
results.subtitle: Envision in Collaboration with Stanford Law School
results.description: This residential program is designed for highly motivated high school students in grades 9-12 who are interested in exploring the legal profession. Participants engage in hands-on legal training including litigation, trial preparation, and public speaking under the guidance of university legal mentors and law school professors. The curriculum features a full-scale mock trial simulation where students step into the roles of attorneys and witnesses to argue a case in a professional courtroom setting. Beyond trial skills, students attend lectures on legal ethics, civil rights, and tort law while receiving guidance on the college and law school admissions process. Qualified attendees can earn two college credits through George Mason University as part of their participation.

results.name: National Summer Transportation Institute
results.title: Early Outreach
results.subtitle: University of Nevada, Las Vegas
results.description: UNLV Early Outreach provides comprehensive college and career readiness programming tailored for K–10 students and their families. The initiative carries out its mission through community engagement opportunities, including school visits to college fairs and family nights. Students can participate in year-round events that foster curiosity about academic paths and offer direct interaction with campus and community partners. The Young Rebels component specifically focuses on academic and social enrichment, encouraging students to engage in critical thinking and build relationships with university faculty and peers.

results.name: Pre-College Residential Programs at UMass Amherst

program_dates.label: Animation and Hollywood VFX in Adobe After Effects
Antibiotic Resistance: A Global Health Crisis
Botanical Breakthroughs: Exploring Biochemical Properties of Plants
Everyday Magic: Chemistry & Its Environmental Impact
Hospitality & Tourism Management Pre-College Leadership Academy
Kinesiology: Pathway to the Medical Professions
Programming for Aspiring Scientists: Python with Applications to Physics (In person)
Programming for Aspiring Scientists: Python with Applications to Physics (Online)
Question Everything: A Summer Philosophy Program
Reading and Writing the Graphic Novel
Writing Journalistic Stories About Social Issues

results.title: Summer Pre-College Residential Programs at UMass Amherst
results.subtitle: UMass Amherst
results.description: These residential pre-college programs are designed for rising high school sophomores through seniors to experience university life while exploring diverse academic interests. Participants choose from a wide array of intensive courses ranging from STEM fields like engineering and microbiology to humanities subjects such as creative writing and philosophy. Students live in residence halls and eat in award-winning dining commons, supported by trained program assistants who help them adjust to the campus environment. The curriculum focuses on hands-on learning, including laboratory research, case competitions, and portfolio preparation. To foster a sense of community, the program also incorporates social events in the evenings and on weekends to help students build connections with their peers.

results.name: University of Kentucky
results.title: STEM THROUGH AUTHENTIC RESEARCH AND TRAINING START Program
results.subtitle: University of Kentucky
results.description: The STEM THROUGH AUTHENTIC RESEARCH AND TRAINING START Program strengthens the STEM community by providing mentorship and authentic experiences to students ranging from middle school to graduate school level. High school juniors and seniors age 16 and older may apply for the apprentice program to gain access to the STEM community while receiving coaching and academic development. Mentorship opportunities are also available for university students to provide guidance and soft skills training to younger aspiring scientists. Additionally, teachers can participate in professional development programs involving research lab placements and workshops to enhance their STEM education skills.

results.name: Artificial Intelligence Bootcamp
results.title: HAI
results.subtitle: Stanford
results.description: Stanford HAI serves as a multidisciplinary hub for the study and development of artificial intelligence. The program integrates perspectives from the humanities and social sciences to guide technical innovation. Its primary mission involves creating AI technologies that are inspired by human intelligence and responsive to human needs. Participants and researchers collaborate on projects that prioritize ethics, safety, and the societal implications of automated systems.

results.name: CISESS
results.title: Summer Internships
results.subtitle: UMD Cooperative Institute for Satellite Earth System Studies (CISESS)
results.description: The UMD Cooperative Institute for Satellite Earth System Studies (CISESS) offers paid summer internships where participants work directly with scientists on various National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) projects. This program is specifically designed for high school seniors and undergraduate students who are interested in gaining hands-on experience in Earth system studies. Interns explore a diverse range of technical topics such as satellite data assimilation, artificial intelligence, 3D visualization, and remote sensing laboratory support. Throughout the program, participants are expected to dedicate approximately 20 hours per week over a span of 10 to 12 weeks to their assigned research and development tasks. Applicants must submit their resumes to the program coordinator to be considered for these mentorship-based positions.

results.name: Cardiothoracic Surgical Skills
results.title: Cardiothoracic Surgical Skills and Education Center Summer Internship
results.subtitle: Stanford Medicine
results.description: The Cardiothoracic Surgical Skills and Education Center Summer Internship is designed for high school students considering careers in science, medicine, and public health. Participants receive instruction from faculty and residents within the Department of Cardiothoracic Surgery through classroom and hands-on basic-to-advanced cardiac surgical training. The curriculum focuses on cardiovascular anatomy and physiology, providing students with specific insights into the field of cardiothoracic surgery. Participants also gain exposure to various surgical techniques that are commonly used in professional medical training. To ensure accessibility for all individuals, the program offers a robust scholarship and assistance program for students with fewer opportunities.

results.name: Mathematics Program
results.title: PROMYS
results.subtitle: Boston University
results.description: PROMYS is a six-week summer program designed for strongly motivated high school students who are carefully selected from across the U.S. and around the world. Participants engage in a residential experience involving deep thinking and creativity through the exploration of challenging mathematical problem sets alongside undergraduate counselors. The program is open to students between the ages of 14 and 18 who have completed the 9th grade but have not yet enrolled in college full-time. Financial accessibility is a priority, with the program being free for domestic students from families earning under $80,000 and offering various need-based aid, scholarships, and fellowships for others. The application process requires students to submit a completed form, high school transcripts, a letter of recommendation, and solutions to a set of challenging mathematical problems.

results.name: National Championship Tournament
results.title: High School National Championship Tournament
results.subtitle: NAQT
results.description: The High School National Championship Tournament (HSNCT) is the premier high school quiz bowl event featuring elite teams from across the United States and the world. To earn a spot in the field, teams must qualify through their performance at regular-season tournaments using questions supplied by the organizing institution. The competition involves a broad subject distribution that tests knowledge in various academic disciplines including science, history, and literature. Registered teams and individual players can prepare for the event using a variety of resources such as sample questions, study guides, and frequency lists provided by the organization. Support is also provided for small schools and new teams to ensure broad participation across the high school academic community.

results.name: Penn State Behrend
results.title: LEADS: An Early College Experience Program
results.subtitle: Penn State Behrend
results.description: LEADS (Learn, Explore, Advance, Discover, and Succeed) is a free, nonresidential summer program for high school students entering their senior year. Participants take a college-credit course alongside undergraduate students, gaining early exposure to university-level academics and interacting with professors. The program includes career exploration through virtual field trips, workshops, and lectures from local businesses, as well as college preparatory sessions. Eligible students typically include first-generation college-bound individuals, those from underrepresented backgrounds, or students with financial need who maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA. Successful completion of the program provides participants with assured first-year admission to the institution upon graduating high school and completing the standard application process.

results.name: Research Experience

program_dates.label: UCSD Research Experience for High School Students (REHS) Summer 2026

results.title: UCSD Research Experience for High School Students
results.subtitle: San Diego Supercomputer Center
results.description: The Research Experience for High School Students (REHS) is an eight-week volunteer internship program designed to increase awareness of computational science and related research fields among students in grades 10 through 12. Participants are paired with university mentors to work on established research projects, where they learn to formulate hypotheses, conduct computational experiments, and participate in regular lab meetings. Throughout the experience, students gain exposure to career options and work readiness skills while working in pairs or small groups to foster peer collaboration and 1:1 mentorship. The program concludes with the development of scientific posters that highlight the students' research and future career goals for display at a celebratory event. Financial assistance is available to cover the registration fee for those who qualify, and students may receive support for transportation needs if required for their participation.

results.name: University of Colorado Boulder
results.title: STEM Research Experience
results.subtitle: CU Science Discovery | University of Colorado Boulder
results.description: The STEM Research Experience is a seven-week program designed for STEM-interested teens who are at least sixteen years of age by the program start. Participants work in pairs under the guidance of faculty and graduate student mentors to conduct hands-on research projects within various scientific disciplines. Throughout the course of the program, students engage in the scientific research process by reviewing literature, supporting experiments, and analyzing data to develop a professional research poster. This selective commuter program requires a fifteen to twenty hour weekly commitment, including a Research Methods seminar and independent lab work. Students conclude their experience by presenting their results at a culminating STEM Research Expo, with some participants potentially continuing their work for publication or professional conference presentations. Admission is based on a selective application process, and the program fee covers mentor stipends, materials, and professional poster printing.

results.name: Online Leadership Intensive
results.title: Online Leadership Intensive
results.subtitle: Northwestern Center for Talent Development
results.description: The Online Leadership Intensive is designed for students in grades 7 through 11 to examine the traits and practices of leadership while assessing their personal strengths and styles. Participants engage in a blend of weekly live online class sessions and independent coursework that promotes skill-building and socially responsible leadership. The curriculum includes academic research, topic-focused presentations, and opportunities to meet with government, business, and nonprofit leaders at the top of their fields. Students also participate in instructor-led teambuilding activities to develop communication and problem-solving skills with their peers. All participants receive a detailed evaluation upon completion of the program that provides feedback on achievements and outlines areas for further growth.

results.name: Tanglewood Institute
results.title: Pre-College And Youth Summer Programs
results.subtitle: Boston University
results.description: Boston University offers a wide range of pre-college and youth summer programs designed for middle and high school students to gain valuable academic experience. These programs provide opportunities to explore various disciplines including biotechnology, mathematics, engineering, and the visual and performing arts. Participants can enhance their existing skill sets through immersive coursework, scientific research internships, and specialized institutes such as the Boston University Tanglewood Institute. In addition to academic pursuits, the university hosts recreational camps for elementary and middle school students through FitRec. This suite of summer offerings is intended to help students discover new interests and prepare for future educational paths in a challenging and engaging environment.

results.name: HighTech Bound
results.title: HighTech Bound
results.subtitle: University of New Hampshire InterOperability Laboratory
results.description: HighTech Bound is a paid summer internship program specifically designed for high school students entering their senior year to gain hands-on experience in network technologies. Participants work in a computer lab alongside dedicated mentors to research and develop solutions for assigned software and hardware projects used by major tech companies. This four-to-six-week experience allows students to collaborate on a team, build real-world technical skills, and prepare for future education in the technology field. Beyond professional development, interns can earn a half high school credit through the Virtual Learning Academy Charter School and may qualify for future employment opportunities.

results.name: GSTEM
results.title: GSTEM
results.subtitle: NYU
results.description: GSTEM is a highly selective six-week summer research program designed for high school juniors with a strong academic background and a passion for STEM disciplines. Participants are paired with professional researchers or professors to work on individual projects in fields such as biology, chemistry, computer science, mathematics, and physics. Throughout the program, students develop essential laboratory techniques, programming skills, and scientific writing abilities while attending weekly field trips to engage with professionals in the industry. The experience concludes with Symposium Day, where students present their research findings to family and friends, and participants receive an official transcript for their graded work. This inclusive program also offers optional on-campus housing and a meal plan to support students as they build connections with peers and mentors.

results.name: Clinical Summer Internship
results.title: Clinical Summer Internship
results.subtitle: Stanford Medicine
results.description: The Clinical Summer Internship provides a transformative experience for rising high school juniors, seniors, and undergraduate pre-medical students looking to explore the art and science of world-class medicine. Participants engage in hands-on medical training and interactive clinical learning through several program formats, including an intensive two-week on-campus session and a live, interactive two-week virtual session. Students also have the option to join a 10-week fall virtual intensive that meets weekly for 90-minute live sessions led by faculty. Throughout these programs, learners work alongside dedicated Stanford medical students, residents, and faculty to gain deeper clinical knowledge and build meaningful professional connections. This fast-paced curriculum is designed for curious and driven individuals ready to dive into clinical practice and discover the joy found in the medical field.

results.name: University of Chicago
results.title: S.M.A.R.T. 2024 (Science, Mathematics, and Research Training)
results.subtitle: University of Chicago
results.description: The SMART Summer Program is a free outreach initiative designed for high school students interested in science and exploration, regardless of their previous experience levels. Organized by faculty, staff, and students from the University of Chicago, the curriculum covers diverse topics such as superconductivity, 3D printing, quantum computing, and renewable energy. Participants engage in hands-on experiments, including building solar cars and designing 3D objects, while visiting premier research facilities like the Argonne National Laboratory and Adler Planetarium. This program prioritizes low-income or first-generation college students from public schools on Chicago’s South Side, offering them direct exposure to research labs and various careers in STEM.

results.name: University of Notre Dame
results.title: QuarkNet Program Information for High School Students
results.subtitle: University of Notre Dame
results.description: QuarkNet is a comprehensive educational program sponsored by the National Science Foundation and the Department of Energy that aims to support science education through a nationwide network. Participants in the program have the opportunity to learn about cutting-edge physics research firsthand while establishing mentoring relationships with university physicists and national laboratories. Students involved in the research program investigate particle physics using live online data to learn about fundamental concepts such as energy, momentum, and the structure of matter. This initiative connects participants to global high-energy physics experiments operating at facilities like CERN, Fermilab, and SLAC, fostering collaboration with scientists and students worldwide.

results.name: Creative Writing Academy
results.title: Creative Writing Academy
results.subtitle: Georgetown University School of Continuing Studies
results.description: The Creative Writing Academy invites high school students to develop their storytelling skills through a blend of classroom lectures, workshops, and peer critiques. Participants explore diverse forms including poetry, fiction, and personal prose while mastering techniques such as character development and story structure. In addition to creative development, the program provides insights into the publishing industry, professional writing careers, and advanced academic programs. Students benefit from mentorship by expert faculty and graduate instructors, and they engage in responsive writing exercises during visits to renowned museums and literary organizations.

results.name: Teen Camp: Natural Dyes
results.title: Michael C. Carlos Museum
results.subtitle: Emory
results.description: The Michael C. Carlos Museum at Emory University offers a diverse range of educational programs and artistic exhibitions for the community. Visitors can explore permanent collections and rotating exhibitions alongside specialized digital programs and publications such as the Den of Antiquity. Educational opportunities are available for all ages, including specific programs for children, families, teachers, and university students. The museum also focuses on conservation and provenance research to ensure the preservation and ethical stewardship of its artifacts. Additionally, university faculty can engage with museum resources to enhance their academic curriculum through various tours and digital projects.

results.name: Eco-Marathon Competition
results.title: Shell Eco-marathon
results.subtitle: Shell
results.description: The Shell Eco-marathon is a global academic competition that challenges student teams to design, build, and drive highly energy-efficient vehicles. Participants focus on maximizing mileage using various energy sources, including hydrogen, battery-electric, and internal combustion engines. This program provides hands-on experience in advanced engineering, aerodynamics, and material science while fostering collaboration among future innovators. Students must navigate technical inspections and track runs to demonstrate their vehicle’s performance and efficiency. By participating in this initiative, teams gain valuable skills in project management and problem-solving while addressing contemporary energy and mobility challenges.

results.name: Neuroscience Research Competition
results.title: Neuroscience Research Prize
